o5DzuTvZ8gBZ0Q9tCtZcLg.text: Went here with the family and I would have to say it was ok. I had the steak salad and the steak was not high quality but just ok. Not sure what I was expecting from a steak salad butttttt I still expected better.  A few in our group had the seafood including my husband and he said it was ok as well.  The atmosphere is ok and the waitstaff was ok. I guess if your looking for some bar type seafood this place is good for that. I cannot say that I will be rushing back anytime soon but I also cannot say that there was really anything wrong with it. I guess I just expected more out of my steak salad than I got.

5MlvCBxh1lfPu_vsWoLNNw.text: Tough to review this place  The service has always been terrible. The food quality always amazing.  Dark and dingy is it a seafood place , a dive bar , late night hang out, or gaming spot.  The staff is always running around looking like it's their first day on the job. I have been seated and waited twenty minutes before acknowledged. And that was because i passed out from hunger  The waiter seemed stressed and didn't want our table or order. The manager seemed perplexed by it all and the ambiance was loud and fun. It's unfortunate that it always seemed like amateur hour because the food is so darn good  Don't think I have ever had a bad meal. The peel and eat shrimp is to die for.   The happy hour seemed to change from my visits. One time I was allowed to order food Togo one time I wasn't on happy hour. The drinks are comped if your playing the machines which is nice and the bar staff had always been friendly.   For the area and late night food it is some of the best around. If you can have a few beers ( if you can get them ) and not stress about service you will enjoy yourseld

YmGUSSLgled0z0G1gAXvVw.text: I live in the area and wanted somewhere different to get some food, drinks, and play a little keno.  Reviews were not very good but, I was pleasantly surprised. Service was perfect. We were greeted as soon as we sat down, asked by numerous bartenders if we needed anything, and very friendly. We happen to go on $1 oyster night which was a plus. The oysters were very nice sized but, a bit gritty. I had the gumbo which was no compare to Oyster Bar quality but, still good. I'd definitely return.

0g2C8lITXS1mZNJSnJzWZA.text: So this was the WORST  service I've ever had here. I live around the corner and this is my favorite place to go to. But I'm seriously considering goin to timbers next time.  I usually order food and hang out with friends. Tonight we all  ordered appetizers and entrees, had a few drinks. Built up a pretty big bill. But still we were having a good time. Our server was nice and she was cute. Had a nice smile. She could have come around to check on us a bit more often but what ever that's ok with us. She got what ever we needed fast so that's all that counts.  She ended up leaving before we were done and told us to go to the bar for anything we needed. Ok sounds easy. NOT! The bartender wes a freaking asshole. We're trying to get our checks (my BF is trying to get them) and the bartender is giving him attitude about what's on what ticket. He doesn't know he was at the bar gambling most of the time. So I walk over and began to try and fix things. My BF turns around and walks away and the bartender throws his arms up and makes a face. (Like woah wtf) so I'm trying to work with the guy he prints up the ticket and throws it to the side then he walks of mumbling something and goes serves other tables. HELLO! I'm trying to get out and pay my bill. (Witch for the table was around $120) after he was done gave us a list of tickets we paid before he could even make drinks for other people.   Needless to say leaving took way longer then it should. Service was shit at the end. Food was ok. Overall I haven't left a place this upset in a long time. Ugh. Good luck.

6S-bXj-FRbic1oF64LMIcA.text: I've liked Schucks food but the trip there tonight reminded me why I don't go there except to remind myself why I don't go there.   The customer service is atrocious. I sat for over 5 minutes at the bar and not once did the brunette bartender acknowledge me in anyway. She got a couple of drinks, went into the kitchen, and then played with her phone cord on a strip outlet by the register. Never once looked up and said she'd be right with me or anything. This reminded me that this has happened to me before there. You basically have to be a regular to get anything resembling adequate service at Schucks.   What is the dysfunction at this bar that they can't get employees to practice just adequate customer service?

n2OzobX74i9cd473HDE90Q.text: Husband home from working in the PA woods for a few days and we have to hit his FAVORITE place for the best mussels known to man. 5.00 mussels Friday nights.

KtmxbRGO1-t8mEflHZeCAw.text: I was watching a re-run of Bizzare Foods recenlty and saw Andrew Zimmern diggnig up clams in Rhode Island.  Suddenly I found myself with a strong craving for fried clam strips.  I used to share a basket with my mom at our favorite sea food place when I was a kid.  I had to have them again.  It had been too long.  After much searching a failed attempt at a restaurant that no longer exists, I found myself at Shucks Tavern.    It was about 9:30 AM when I was in the area and I knew Shucks to be open 24/7.  So in I walked and was immediately handed a menu for breakafast items.  I gave the guy a funny look and asked if they were serving only breakfast or if I could order from the regular menu.  He said I could order anything and must have been confused by my request.  I mean who wouldn't be.  I'm sure most people don't tend to order fried clams at 9:30 in the morning.  But I've never been one for breakfast foods and I had a craving.  So I ordered my fried clams, a side salad with Italian dressing and an ice tea.    What seemed like many minutes went by and were fewer than it seemed.  Soon I had my salad and a nice plate of fried clams.  They were impressive too.  Dark golden brown.  Big and meaty.  There was a large cup of cocktail sauce and a couple of lemon wedges on the side.  The salad was perfect for a side.  Mixed greens, tomato, onion.  The perfect amount of dressing.  The vinegar woke up my taste buds and got me ready for the good stuff, the clams.  And they were good.  Tender but still chewy to let me know they were the real deal.  None of this chopped formed garbage.  Perfectly fried and crispy.  The cocktail sauce was amazing.  There was enough horse radish to make me sweat.  A little extra lemon juice mixed in and it was perfect.  I ate down those crispy little bi-valves and felt this sense of euphoria wash over me.  My craving had been satisfied and I was ready to begin the rest of my day.  Everybody else can keep their Wheaties.  For me, fried clams first thing in the morning is the True breakfast of champions.

-pLz1uB9eLjO_CHbjZA8kg.text: Service has a lot to be desired. If you like being ignored at the bar then you'll like it here. My boyfriend had crab cakes which he described as "gross cakes". Just ordered oysters Rockefeller one if my favorites! But at this "oyster bar" the oysters were the worst part I only ate 2 and finished the lackluster spinach due to extreme hunger just plain eww.   I've been here before and ordered a spinach dip that was so cold in the middle I had to return it so they could heat it up, it wasn't any better warm though. This place has just been such a huge disappointment. It's walking distance from my house but I would rather drive to a bar that has better food and service. Sorry not sorry.

JuDwO5V6pSjs7f8TxZfu2Q.text: I only come here for the alcohol. So I haven't really had the food here that is not the chicken tenders. Now the chicken tenders are top notch. Outside of that, the alcohol is a bit pricey unless it's happy hour. Even then, they need happy hour more often. Now back to the food part.   I've been here a few times and mileage may vary. My first time, I was with co workers and we waited over an hour for our food. Granted we didn't leave because we were all drinking but if it wasn't for my co workers being there. I would of just left and get food elsewhere. The following times the service was much faster.

ZbcsIVTuM6dqI_tmY0sgKg.text: I just love this place! This time tried the sea tacos with grilled cod... SO GOOD. My son had their shucks burger and it was also great. Fries have been on point every time... And their cheesecake.. Damn good. Everyone was so nice. We had Nicolette as our main server and she was great :) I know I should try new places, but I really do enjoy shucks too much to branch out right now!

uVf2F3pAWMUS5pz4UB5eAA.text: We ate here yesterday and everything was fantastic. Our server was Nicki and she was awesome. She was friendly, personable, and recommended items that turned out to be excellent. They have a really cheap priced kids menu (you have to ask about it). My son had chicken fingers and fries. We plan to go back kid free and sit at the bar once college and NFL sports season begins.

xbcVJMGnMZU7cpg0YQrogw.text: My family and I have been eating at Shucks for several years now. The food has always been great, but the service is so hit or miss. Lately more miss than hit.   The kitchen is small and the wait staff is only marginal. It's fine as long as it's not busy. But if you go on a Friday night, expect to wait forever. Tonight, I had to ask for a waiter to take out order because we sat for almost 15 minutes without being greeted by our waiter. Then the table next to us, who was sat after us and waited on after us for their appetizers and entrees before we were served anything. I had to ask for a manager.   Like I said, the food never disappoints. But I'm not sure we will be eating here anymore with the lack in service.

JhV9EwSEDHB2AspiJbUNLw.text: Hey Josh. We came back again after 3 years and we are so glad we did.!! Seriously we love the food there so much that we want to come almost everyday but we can't. We have had 3 times now the Spanish waiter with the glasses. He is fantastic and he's off sun Monday so we come in when he's there. IQvQlKUfljqh7eyMPu0tLA.text: My wife and I recently moved into the area and haven't had a chance to hit up the grocery store. She has been craving Clam Chowda ( east coasters :)  and i just happened to come across the menu for this place and saw they had it.  Wife yelled SOLD!    Walking in , its the normal bar , tv screens tables and booths.  It was a little grungy in there , but nothing i havent seen before.   They have a decent amount of beers on tap , i ordered a New Castle , the wife had a Coors light ( EWWW ).  Ordered up a cup and bowl of clam chowda ! ,  it was very thick , had the right amount of clam to potato and veggie ratio and was very tasty.     Out came the rest of the food.  My wife ordered the Boston Cod Sandwhich. Its basically a upscale McDonald fish fillet , but was outstanding.  Had alot of flavor and the fish , didn't taste fishy.  I ordered the Fish Fry .. and man was i in for a treat. I had a HUGE plate of fried haddock which was extremely flavorful and tender\moist.  I enjoyed it completely.     They have alot of non fried light choices on the menu such as crab stuffed tilapia.  We will definitely be back to try these !.   Try it , you wont be disappointed.

JlocDx_Lca-ic-beYF2dag.text: Great food and great service. We eat here all the time and have never had a bad experience. Some of the best and freshest seafood in town.

QVgUUaVD3Z9DqHCYmk0Yfg.text: Just had lunch at Shucks. All I can say is WOW! Great food and service. Amanda was cute and attentive.They offer 2 for 1 wraps and sandwiches on Wed. I had the Frisco club. This thing was like a club sandwich on steriods. Grilled chicken breast, bacon, lettuce, tomato, ham, two kinds of cheese and sliced avocado on thick sliced sourdough. They also offer $2 domestic and $3 premium drafts on Mon. and Wed. Great lunch for two under 20 bucks including tip and a couple of beers.  Its a little hidden. Directly across the street from Smiths but what a find. My new favorite place. I'll be back for sure.

yF4Pqwv9COCtdKo6Oc1SPg.text: I love this place and I come here all the time; excellent seafood!  It's open 24hrs, so its convenient when you want seafood at 3am!  They have a large selection of seafood here, everything from shrimp platters to crab legs, oysters, mussels, wraps tacos, clam bakes, gumbo and pastas.  The prices are very reasonable too.  The bartenders are awesome.  The atmosphere here is very chill/low key.  Great place to grab some beer and seafood with friends.  They also have great deals on breakfast; I think the breakfast is priced around $4.  Its definitely worth checking out!  Its kind of hidden though; its near the corner of elkhorn/durango; across from Smiths.  You'll have to drive around to the back to park.

CIwW-mBGq0QkEkRMRbnoIQ.text: came here for some late munching (or more like pigging out) and ordered oysters, linguine with clams, lamb chops with salad, and jumbo shrimp.  i'm not an oyster eater but i was told it was pretty good.  the linguine was definitely very very yummy but if you're on a diet, i'd say stay away from this pool of butter.  the lamb chops were average, not nearly as good as the ones we has at texas de brazil the night before, but the salad that came with it was pretty good.  altho i'm sure you're not going to order some lamb chops just for the side salad.  last but definitely not least, the jumbo shrimps.  they are jumbo alright... these "shrimps" are more like lobsters!  they tasted so good.  great texture, lightly seasoned so it's not overpowering, and it comes with a little tub of butter.  i had them w/o butter and they were delicious.  would definitely come back again on our next vegas trip!

o-C87laXW4EqIxxxjfBtzQ.text: this place is cool. i've only been here once and enjoyed it very much. we ordered the Shuck's Clam Bake for two and got, clams, snow crab, dungeness crab, king crab, corn and red potatoes- all for under 25 bucks. i thought that was a great deal. the seafood was tasty and seemingly fresh. i left full and satisfied.

iZXsxcWdietRWEO9ic3N7A.text: My bf and I were looking for a good place to go for breakfast besides Ihop and Denny's, this place fit the bill. They offered a decent selection of 10-12 meals with extra sides at the bottom of the menu for a couple dollars more. I had your typical breakfast meal (2 eggs, 3 slices of bacon, hash browns, and an english muffin)...  everything was cooked perfectly and tasted wonderful! Don't expect Claim Jumper portions but you will get a filling meal for only $3.95! The waitress was fantastic and had a great personality which is very rare these days! We will be coming back soon to try out the dinner menu and will definitely be recommending this place to people in the NW.

asBTc-wD4bTfqRM-ZITk0A.text: Love this place since seafood and Las Vegas are normally hard to combine. Since I am from the NW (part of the country) and near the ocean, I thought the portions were a bit small for the prices. Creative menu and drinks, some of them I have never heard of and enjoyed tremendously. We had the clam bake for two that was just enough for one of us (we love seafood and grew up with it) and I had a pasta seafood dish. Tasty. Atmosphere was nice although the occasional drunk from across the bar made conversation a bit rough at times. Seat yourself, you choose your booths! Would go back anytime but probably when I got paid again since we left after spending $130 for two.

pEVLYwSEybDCEqtN7s-y_Q.text: DIRTY AND DISGUSTING. The food may be good here, but when I went into the restroom, there was NO soap in any of the four soap dispensaries. Nor were there any towels. I asked our server to put some soap in there and he said he would. When I went back in a few minutes later, there still was no soap. When he came to our table with our food and I told him he laughed and thought it was funny. I don't know about my fellow diners, but I believe that any place that has no soap for its customers is an absolute indicator that the cooks, servers or any of the other staff simply don't wash their hands. GROSS.

oM9_BGRqDsvh3Q4GtLjm4A.text: We love shucks. My husband and I come here every Wednesday morning for breakfast and sometimes my mom and I come for dinner. Their food is great. Joe is their best waiter by far. Great service and friendly.

BKlApJPjDoqJCIgWSgyAOQ.text: Recently moved to NW Las Vegas and have been checking out the neighborhood restaurants and taverns. Shucks quickly became a favorite after we had 2 dinners, a lunch, and several breakfasts. Joenna is our restaurant favorite server and ???our favorite bartender. (So sorry we don't know...gorgeous with long dark hair in ponytail..........worked until 3:30 or 4 pm today ( NCAA Gonzaga v S. Carolina [april 1].   Went to Shucks to see game and enjoy the atmosphere. So disappointing......the food and the later bar service. Food: ordered basic cheese nachos. Had to ask for guacamole and sour cream that came with them. $7.95 Nachos were soggy and stale. We just thought that was a lesson to us not to order appetizers. Later, ordered the $25.95 "build your own order". Being shrimp lovers, We ordered cocktail shrimp, popcorn shrimp, coconut shrimp and the peel and eat shrimp. (We had previously ordered the coconut shrimp and popcorn shrimp as entrees during another visit.)  Wow, how disappointing. 10 small popcorn shrimp supposedly equaled 1/2 pound. The cocktail shrimp were the same as the peel and eat.....mushy and miserable. We sent them back, requesting more coconut or popcorn shrimp. Frankly, I believe the cook peeled 4 of the shrimp we sent back and deep fried them...no resemblance to the first portion of coconut shrimp. Truly angered me.   Additionally, we sat at the bar with empty glasses waiting for someone (of the 3 bar staff) to notice. We are well dressed, well behaved adults, and the bar was not very busy.   We left. Will we go back? Can't tell you...we're home watching Oregon win, in comfort.

zaBfgMaW0Xg5O5-OjaBNOQ.text: The front of this restaurant faces a parking lot, with the back facing the road, so you have to be paying attention to find it. Once inside, it reads like a typical sports bar - smokey, lots of TVs, with half of the interior taken up by a dining area with some booths and low tables. The menu is EXTENSIVE. Usually not a great sign, but the food we got was acceptable. I had the Shuck's salad, which has a little piece of tuna, two shrimp, and a tiny scoop of crabmeat on a romaine salad with a vinaigrette dressing. It also came with a piece of cheesy texas toast on the salad which wasn't my thing. We also ordered the crab cakes, which in my opinion were small for the price. They tasted fine though, and the two came with a small salad of slaw in between them on the serving plate. No one got sick, extra point for that. My soda didn't ever get refilled though, so that was a minus.   They have specials which are listed as you walk in, mostly things like X for half price on Tuesdays kind of thing. They also have rotating daily specials on a board inside the door. Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but if I am in the area in the future and have deemed all other options less desirable, I might come back to try the crab legs since that seemed to be the most raved about menu item. Maybe I'm just not that used to eating in a bar where people are smoking and my server doesn't refill my drink, but given that, the food was just fine.

2O4ulE2so2_ZbjHwXrd1pg.text: So good and so simple.  I love their oysters.  The mothershucker burger is huge and always cooked medium rare when I order it this way and the jambalaya has just enough kick to it that keeps me coming back.  Shucks is faithful to me in the sense that they're open 24 hours and not that run down of a place.   I think I've posted a years worth of pictures before writing this review but whenever I'm in the north west area of Las Vegas I know for sure Shucks is always a good option for me to fall back on.  Let me wrap this up by saying the Salmon entree is excellent, the pork chop appetizer is always good, and the black cod/catfish dishes are gravy too.    Do not hesitate ever to walk in!

lvoVdD6LoF4jAp8tV3SiJg.text: Does this place ever disappoint?  Not so far for me!  This time I began with a dozen cold and very delicious oysters on the half shell and a side Caesar Salad that was fresh, cool, and enhanced by a surprisingly good zesty Caesar Dressing.  This was followed by a generous portion of nice and flaky fresh Parmesan Halibut with drinkable Lemon Butter Sauce that was paired with tasty moist Rice Pilaf.  Meanwhile my dining companions enjoyed Fish & Chips with colossal Onion Rings, and a Crab Bucket containing equal parts of Dungeness Crab and Snow Crab, along with great Roasted Red Potatoes.  We again enjoyed fine service and an overall five-star dining experience!

fbF-_Rov-HWc2JuxO02xcg.text: If you're from the south and looking for fried food, you'll be disappointed, but for the most part it wasn't a bad place. I got the fried shrimp and fried oysters and they were mediocre. If I were to go back I'd probably try something other than fried seafood. The staff was extremely professional, polite and tentative.

I1MUBA6r16Np28xnyRu1QA.text: I come here a lot and I love it! The first time I came here, I hit my first 5 spot playing Keno (I'm not old... I swear)! The first time I came here was a little off though. We didn't get ID'd from a blond server. I would understand if we looked over 30 but I'm 21 and Chris is 24. The server with the red hair is amazing! She is great at recommending food, drinks, and just fun to talk to! I wasn't too fond of Doug at first, but he's really great to me now!   There is smoking in this bar so don't come in here and complain about that. Most bars have smoking anyway. It's opened 24 hours too which is a huge plus being down the street! It's right across the street from Smiths on N. Durango and Elkhorn. I think it's cool that they have an ATM inside as well!   Now for food. The bacon wrapped shrimp ($8.95) is to die for. The bacon is crispy and has this amazing smokey taste to it. The shrimp in this dish are huge as well! The Wild West burger ($10.95) is really good. Huge sized burger and extremely juicy. It comes with a side of fries! Their garlic fries are my favorite. It is extremely garlicey so just a heads up. If you don't like garlic, obviously it isn't meant for you. Their mashed potatoes are really good too but you need to add a lot of salt to it. Onion rings are the thicker cut ones (my favorite style) and it's extremely crispy. Their shrimp tacos were a little disappointing to be honest. If you're going to get tacos, get their chicken ones. Those ones were amazing! I love the fish n chips here! ($11.95) Again their portioning sizes for everything are huge. I just thought it was a little heavy on the stomach. My favorite food wise is their pasta dishes. The portions are huge! The scampi ($13.95) was amazing. It has so much flavor in it. Perfectly cooked noodles as well. The seafood fra diavolo plate (18.95) is all over the place, but in a good way. There's so much going into this dish. You get your shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels in a huge plate. The sauce is a little spicy too, it adds such an amazing flavor. The scallops in that were my favorite! Their shrimp Alfredo (14.95) is my favorite dish here, but keep in mind that I haven't separately gotten oysters or clams yet. They actually put a good amount of shrimp in it, it's so cheesy and delicious. It's not as thick as most places make it but it's still a heavy dish. It comes with a piece of toast on it as well. Their french toast on their breakfast menu is amazing! You get that with ham, bacon, and sausage for just $5! It's well worth it and filling as well. I love their chicken fried steak and eggs. $6.95 for that. The steak is a little small but the gravy is perfectly seasoned. Honestly the prices are worth it for everything I've tried here.  All in all I love it here. The service is great no matter who it is, the food is definitely worth the prices! Has to be one of my favorite places to go.

gMhufWUytTgGo-LwOiW_-A.text: First time here...having just moved to Nevada(vegas) it's still odd to see gaming in so many locations! What got me the most was the smoking in the bar...haven't seen that in a restaurant area in years. It wasn't too bad but noticeable.  The beer and mixed drinks were tasty. The beer was cheap at 2$ for a 16 oz special. We ordered tuna tartare to start and wanted 10 more...it was that good. Very fresh and big chunks of raw tuna with avocado and balsamic was amazing.   We had 1 1/2 lbs of mixed crab legs which were flavorful and meaty. We had a side of onion rings and they were just ok.   Overall I can see us heading back for more. On a side note it was very chilly inside. Take a jacket!

eTdqLeRYWxulOkGsXOCERw.text: We were kinda of skeptical since it's seafood in Vegas, but this place did not disappoint. We will be back soon for more. There is so many different options to choose from that 1 night of eating wasn't enough.

VEyIW8l5xNWHgVkjwlqumA.text: I love this place. I come here all the time and know a lot of the staff. The food is always great and the waiters are always friendly.

Srnn0vuYdp-dLNR0zHsy4Q.text: Good food, horrible service. This is the third time I've gone in and have received poor service. It takes forever for the bartender/waitress to come over or even address you.Then once they finally do, they take your order, give you one drink and you basically have to hunt them down where you're ready to order a second drink, so plan to finish your food before someone even comes over to offer you another drink. It's unfortunate that the service is so poor because otherwise I would have given them 5 stars. Obviously if I come in to a restaurant/bar I'm looking to eat and drink, not just stare at the tv's empty handed. I will say the one time I came in and sat on the restaurant side, the waiter was super attentive and the experience was pleasant but that bar side ruins it for me.

5wm0S1ElhEvYI6Z9uQqzew.text: Great seafood, inexpensive, with great service. Now to the down side, very smokey   even in the dining side, also very busy on the weekends. Will definitely still go back.

g3VtGE-JwBjKK1ChVnzqgg.text: I was told this place had $1 oysters at midnight.  Since I'm allergic to shellfish, I don't really care, I came here for the company and not for the food.  For people like me, there are non-shellfish options such as fish, chicken wings, fries, burgers and alcohol!  We sat at the bar.  They have black jack/ keno machines, etc.  The bar tender was cool.  I got a Malibu Bay Breeze per Honny's recommendation as I perused through the menu. The waffle fries comes with ketchup and ranch dipping sauce...they were good.  It must have been the alcohol or I simply had a death wish because I ordered Rockefeller oysters when I didn't have Benadryl.  I remember liking them when I was little before I developed my allergies.  It seemed like a good idea at that moment until I ate 3 oysters and some of my friend's Cajun shrimps - and my arm, my face and my back started to itch and my stomach started to hurt...the only thing I was waiting on was the anaphylactic reaction.  Centennial Hills Hospital is only a few blocks away so I wasn't worried.  Good oysters though...spinach, cheese, oyster with a bit of hot sauce...mmmm...  In New England, you can get a dozen oysters for $12-13 at a very good restaurant.  Shucks' $1 oyster at midnight = $12 for a dozen from their Graveyard Menu...sounds like a good deal to me.  They're open 24/7 too and also on their Graveyard Menu: burger with fries for  $4, wings and fries for $4-8, chicken fingers and fries for $5-10, shrimps for $5 and clam strips for $4.  Late-night cheap eats!

rAkpn7eJjBBIOSr48O_Miw.text: I've read a lot of the other reviews and will consider trying this place again one day based on those. They get two stars from me because they are open and serve food 24/7. I've worked restaurants all over this country and know 24/7 is a struggle itself. I personally didn't have a good experience at all. I walked in, all be it during their "down time" I'm sure. I was one of 5 people in the place. Two team members eating at a corner table(everyone has to eat and I'm in no way put off by this.) The dishwasher was sitting watching tv, again breaks happen and that's not bothersome to me. My issue is that there was one lady at the bar besides myself. She had maybe a sip of beer left for the 15 min I was there(would be my last ever here if I was her). I came in to grab a bite to eat and an application since I was new to the area then. Sadly I was never even offered a drink, much less would I EVER work here now. Maybe next time the bartender that I literally stared at the whole time I was there will realize she is in the customer service industry. Randomly tapping on her register but, really texting and on her phone the whole time is very obvious and frustrating. Especially to someone in the industry. I'll have to go in when they are slammed on a Friday night and see if the staff is ready and on point for service then or if they just have a great location and are only getting business because, this is Vegas and they are one of two bars in the immediate area. Which the other bar a couple doors down always seems to be busy no matter the hour and they have great food, drinks and service. Hopefully next time I will actually get served here and can rate the food, drinks and service instead of lack there of. I think I was extremely fair not just giving 0 stars. Not possible but, that's probably what this particular visit should have received.

SqvEbfJ2tknPXFwM-sJrEA.text: They lose a star because the service is just OK....but for bar food I have ate at both the centennial and the flamingo location (for paint nite) and both are great, but I do think the portions at the centennial location are larger. I always get the scallops with ginger glaze and it is a HUGE portion and always very tasty. The garlic fries are AMAZING!! Family friendly also! I definitely choose Shucks over a PT's or Timbers for a good, reasonably priced meal.

q3nvqs4rpIru74mB4GcsYg.text: The food was good loved the pancakes, next time trying seafood looks  yummy . Great service very. Friendly people ,I will be back

6ug4FgA0w3FCESuqpUBl4g.text: After seeing all the reviews on this place and its late night specials I couldn't wait to try this place being that I love oysters and a great happy hour spot. OK so we went here late Saturday night around 1am! Walking in the bar came across as a Pretty friendly bar. It seemed as though everyone knew everyone. The bar staff was friendly, nice and attentive! He took our drink order and dropped off the late night menu... the menu everyone had been ranting and raving about, the menu That brought us to this bar only to find out.. the menu changed!! Yes changed! NO burger and fries deal, no calamari special the only the thing that was the same was the $1 oysters! When we asked the bartender what's up w the the menu he Told us it had changed.. So I ordered the Rockefeller oysters, fried oysters and a couple raw ones as well and they were delicious.  The cook brought them out which nice. Overall the place was nice and the food was good but I wouldn't go out of my way to drive that far for it..

6VL6RvRuwzdOy_EMf1Gb9w.text: Can't stop thinking about this place since I went two weeks ago. I know I was rather tipsy when I was there, but I do remember the food being great and the service being even better. Darvey (Sp?) was our amazing bartender!!!!! I woke up the next morning (afternoon) with my chicken wings by my side and they were still yummy. Thanks Darvey, Darby...you catch my drift...

gyNqZp8GCHRXmHqAVeMlQQ.text: My family comes here on a regular basis when in the mood for seafood. It's a great neighborhood joint with a super cozy feel. The service is always top notch and the food is consistently fresh. My kids love the popcorn shrimp kids meals, and having to help them finish a few times i can attest to the fact that they are quite tasty. I can't bring myself to ever order anything besides the Clambake. It includes 1lb of snow crab legs, 1/2 lb of dungeness crab legs, 1lb clams, corn, potatoes and sausage. I have not yet been successful in actually finishing it but it never stops me from trying. My 10 year old shares it with me on most occasions. As a matter of fact, this was her restaurant of choice to celebrate her most recent birthday. We had 11 guests in all and the service was seamless. I called in advance and they set aside an area for our large party. My Dad raved about the fish fry platter, so I might have to try that at some point. I'm also curious about the breakfast specials!

DMTijjxBBEOKkEkR-a-wdQ.text: For a restaurant/bar type dive, I think this place is great! I always have great and friendly service whether I'm sitting at the bar or in the restaurant side. I personally am not a huge fan of seafood but I enjoyed most of what they have to offer. The bacon wrapped shrimp was good just not very much for an appetizer! The prices are very cheap in my opinion. This is my favorite dive in the area based on food and atmosphere!

D_ucZhcafIk02KtAkQ7xiA.text: Good food, good service. Great menu for people who dig seafood.  $1.00 oyster night on Thursday :)

4ZRXsVWTesVrdW3eyyvn1Q.text: It was a Sunday afternoon with hubby and the in laws. We all were super hungry and felt like seafood. After searching for seafood restaurants on Yelp, I came across Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar. I printed out a coupon ($10 off of a bill $50 or more) and we hit the road.   At first, we were all very skeptical and the restaurant's building wouldn't reveal anything about what was expecting us inside. Finally we got over our fears and entered the restaurant. The atmosphere was very friendly, even though a little smoky, since the bar wasn't separated from the dinning area.   For the first hour we were the only customers in the entire restaurant, which didn't bother us at all. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. We asked him about his favorite on the menu and he suggested the Clam Bakes for $26.95, which feeds up to 2 people and includes the following:          Manila Clams (1 lb)     Snow Crab (1 lb)     Dungeness Crab (1/2 lb)     Andouille Sausage     Red Potatoes     Corn  We ordered 2 of it and WOW, it looked and tasted amazing. The clams were very fresh and tasteful, and so were the snow crabs and the rest of the goodies in that shell looking bowl.   As we asked for the desert menu the waiter came back after about 10 minutes with a tray of different cakes and ice cream samples. We all thought that was very cute and the effort was what counted. We decided for a piece of chocolate cake and the fried cheesecake burritos. They both were very delicious.   I would definitely go back to Shucks. The food was fresh and tasty and price value relationship was great.

HK25Yg69LK7w8POmDsHyqw.text: Great palce to come for Raw Oysters and a cold beer, especially on a Sunday for NFL games! The Clam bake is large and will surely satisify your craving for shell fish!   Laid back atmosphere-- nothing too fancy, yet not a hole in the wall either.

BZiQ8tNlUiBsvKsvHW66bA.text: Ehhh.  I checked out this place because several of my friends told me how great it was.  It was just okay.  Had the crab stuffed tallipia with wild rice and veggies.  A little greasy for my taste.  My husband had the pulled pork and waffle fries - he enjoyed his non-seafood better than I enjoyed mine.  The atmosphere was okay, the staff was friendly, prices were fair, but the food was not the best I've had.

w2PeYKcC5dt468K-EmWqyw.text: There bus boy although he resembled Ellen Degeneres was very helpful and polite. Food was amazing and service from them employees was phenomenal. Trevor well done son.

T_8LOGcrocXo6YKW0cFthA.text: Newcastle on tap, of course I'm there!  My father loves this place so it is always in the plan to have dinner there when he is here.  We always start with oysters on the half shell which are always good and hot wings which are pretty good too.  For dinner I always get the crab cakes and side salad.   The crabcakes are yummy!  The side salad is top notch as well.  My hubby loves there alfredo and the kids like the food a lot too.  We have tried just about everything and it's all good.  Love the Clam Bake and Ahi tacos.  If you are a seafood lover, try this and you will not be disappointed!  Good sandwiches and steak and ribs....I just can't stop..they have it all and it's ALL GOOD!

xqdywEwVAcbRyzmJvtO5lQ.text: By the owner of Beanos comes... Shucks.  After being a regular at Beanos, I thought that I knew what to expect: Hole in the wall, decent food.  Wasn't expecting a large, regular late-night crowd, friendly crowd, and a varied, delicious sea-food menu available at all hours along with some very affordable breakfast deals!    It's now high on my list of late-night dining simply for the quality of food: for example - excellent garden omelet for four bucks that comes with the usual toast and poattoes.  But the tomatoes are simmered, the spinach is plentiful, the mushrooms are roasted before being tossed into the eggs.  It's worth the ten minute drive up the 95 for me.    The seafood is fresh and plentiful - they don't skimp on the portions!

PuS2eJPX0d5Aoi1CW5r6OA.text: Awesome Food and Great service always! The Buffalo Shrimp Wrap is super delicious! Try it or you're missing out!

WnchOkFyNPAubycEIv70FA.text: Yummy chicken fingers and fries!! Good service and cheap prices. Can't go wrong for a late night meal :)

IbzOPDIp8n2CGqgyX24iOA.text: My husband and I enjoy bogo sandwiches and wraps Wednesday evenings. The food is always superb! I would give this review 5 stars if it was just based on food. The crab legs are fresh, sweet and juicy. Love the fries and buffalo chicken wrap. However the service here is horrible, if you're unfortunate enough to get one of the girl waitresses. Takes 10 min to even be greeted luckily by then you have already decided what to eat. The food is out pretty fast because the cook usually brings it. Then it takes 30 min to be able to pay and leave.. Anyway if you have extra time to wait and don't mind dinner taking two hours they have good food.

t_EQhte9TDBIQ7VnTGrS3A.text: Came here on a Thursday night to have a bite to eat.  I guess the football game had just ended and this place was a ghost town.  I thought it would still be full of people having drinks and hanging out, but I guess I was wrong.    We seated ourselves over by the bar area and it took a couple minutes for the server to come over and take our order.  We ordered a couple beers and the fish tacos, steak salad and a cup of seafood bisque.  The seafood bisque was super salty!  I wanted to take it home and mix it with canned soup to dilute it.    The fried fish tacos were actually pretty large and filling, and the flavor was good being not too dry and not too fishy.  The steak salad was good except for having too much bleu cheese.  Luckily we asked for the dressing on the side or else the flavor would have been too overwhelming.  The steak was seared and cooked almost like tartare which we liked.  But the rest of the salad was unremarkable in my opinion.  Next time I will come back to try oysters in some form, be it raw or rockefellar.  Maybe during a football game where they have discounts on food and drinks.

u0QjrKFd1QR_QE53SMNZ2w.text: Have been here many many times and we love this place as it open 24/7 great fresh and juicy food, great selection of liquors and pretty comfortable.

e06vwvaz1Ss6eNwbqjrTgw.text: Not cool. I have been here several times now and decided to take my daughter here for breakfast. Apparently they don't allow kids in here before 4pm because of some health code?? That's a little concerning... So I guess the only time to bring my 4 year old here is later in the day when it's full of drunks and smokers? I've only came here for drinks because the one time I ordered food, my burger didn't taste right and made me sick. Service has never impressed me, and I will Not be coming back!!

YvvkLKxCHglJXrLxDYdABQ.text: The food here is absolutely amazing - everything I order completely exceeds my expectations! The burgers are so flavorful and delicious. The steak tacos really rocked!  The service is super friendly and they make you feel special!  Thanks for a great experience every time!

2C-J5VWvhJIq4QUeuduWDQ.text: I first learned of Shuck's a couple of years ago after a friend told me about their fantastically inexpensive breakfast specials. Until now I had only visited the Flamingo/215 location and only for breakfast. When looking for place for the midday meal, the Mrs. and I opted for Shuck's. The only disappointment here is that I hadn't previously tried their lunch menu. They have a burger called the Mother Shucker that features a full pound of beef.  I opted for the smaller version or the "Baby Mother." It came with fries (you can get garlic fries) and I added a side salad. The side salad was one the larger ones I've seen and featured red leaf lettuce, tomato and onion. Even the Baby Mother was huge and some kind of tasty. The waitress, Ashley, was very friendly and attentive, offering her advice on which fried fish the Mrs. should get. Good call on the Haddock Ashley. It was fresh and crisp, complete with garlic fries. I left stuffed like a Thanksgiving Turkey, with a smile on my face. Next time I'll attempt the Mother Shucker.

B9wz0dprVK2lGNcSNfpjcQ.text: Let me get you up to date -  They changed the menu. They are now giving less food and upped the prices. This is very sad. The food is still good, but I'm very disappointed on how they made the changes.

MjE4gM6FDrLn_n6G3dc5bg.text: Love this place! Come here regularly with some buddies to catch up and get a few drinks at the bar. Food is bomb, staff is friendly, and prices are fair. Would recommend this place to anyone looking to relax at a great bar and grub on some delicious food.

Rh0GMQF5EapZgFDwzuqD2A.text: I've never been anywhere else where you can receive poor service, say something about it just to later be punished with an erroneous charge. To top it off, God forbid they make it right..... Instead, I was advised to dispute the charge with my bank. What a joke, it's a shame considering their food is really good.

fDwsR-CrNBELrehDzYlrMg.text: My boyfriend keeps reminding me that you have to review a place for what it is.  Meaning, I can't review Shucks Tavern next to Sage restaurant.    With that said, for a 24 hour gaming bar with an oyster bar attached this is top notch.  The seafood was all super fresh.  The boy ordered clam strips and a crab bucket.  Both were delicious and fresh.  I had the fish tacos, heavy on the cabbage, but I like cabbage.  It was a celebratory dinner so we had carrot cake and it was flavorful and moist.  The service was great and the drink specials were good for a Friday night (half price martinis?  Yes please!).    We would definitely go back, especially since the boy often gets a craving for crab.

X5s-2HraaPJA3KvI8yMfGQ.text: Food was fantastic!.. We had so much to eat! Love my seafood.. Staff was friendly. The women's restroom are disgusting! There's vomit on the doors! Never will I ever return because of that reason.

Wish the restaurant had better separation from the bar, so you don't walk out smelling like an ashtray. Half pound of Dungeness was great, though likely not enough to get me to come back.

63zHttK8gVoY5bqEHotUwQ.text: This place is great..it's clean and the food is amazing ...the best coconut shrimp I have ever had.. my boyfriend had the taco sampler and it was delicious..

6NSX_QG2o-43ANN3iQOy5w.text: Yummy crab legs at great prices!! I thought the oysters were a little slimy but my hubs loved them!

h-YZ-NJlrKReNlz96ZtBGA.text: My favorite Shuck's location! Sometimes you just need some raw oysters and a cold pale ale!   I've eaten at all Shuck's and never had questionable freshness on the seafood.  Great little menu in a local bar.

yIUWY7wIm0GlJ7iXXaOpIA.text: Worst Bears bar I've ever been to. Place is filled with smoke. Food is average.   Service was not friendly. Neither were the bears fans.

kk5DgeKYdL7Jnr17V_2-Hg.text: Great food and drinks, my favorite local bar. The food is a lot better quality than most bars in town. Best fish n Chips I've had anywhere and they have very cold Lagunitas IPA on tap which is great. Prices are very reasonable too and they have no problem comping drinks if you're playing a little.

nc2bDYXnLyp-5Lss-ax7hw.text: The Oyster bake (Rockafeller)   is the ONLY way oysters should be ate. 100% perfection life will nvr be the same

ZD97G2_zfXdAWlxW452KWg.text: I was happier her in my first visit. The second time, not so much. Our server sucked the second time around. I'll still retire for the coconut shrimp! It was amazing.

FBNUfEPmIR0C8ly3SytTbQ.text: The customer service here is amazing. Tonight with a full house, we were taken care of by 3 different servers. All with polite manners.   Only thing that's changed since my last review is the food.   Ordered: Mother Shucked with garlic fries 1 pound Dungeness crab  I have tried the Shuck burger and the mother shucker in the past and am quite familiar with the taste. Now, the flavor is just not the same. I've been giving them a go since I moved here in 2013, and there seems to be something different about the seasoning. 8 of 10 on the juicy rating, (well that's considering I get it medium rare). And for the Dungeness, tonight seemed a bit dry, maybe a bit over cooked. This has happened to us several times in the past 6 months. Not consistent,  so may just be different cooks. What I can say is, gotta try the garlic fries!   Definitely love the way the crew treats their customers, and how attentive they were. But I'll give it another 6 months try before updating again, just to see if it's just me or a change in cooks that's making my tongue confused. Sorry shuck 3 stars for now, but I will be coming around.

Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 calamari
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dungeness

7bIQsi2ODHZnIFA_K7_P_w.text: They recently added a bunch of different Moscow Mule's. I had a regular one and I'm watermelon one, both very good. Menu looks great, but I stuck to my normal Shucks burger. Really good. Best thing was the service from Jeremy. Every time we come here he's attentive and very friendly.

O9lczXgTYtpkJPA3GYpYZw.text: Was not impress with this place.   We were at Centennial Hospital awaiting for our sis in law to deliver our little bundle of joy, Rylan. We were all so famished I Yelped the area and found this place. seafood bar?! Uhh yaaaaas!   Upon arriving I really had a good feeling about this place. Maybe I ordered wrong but I also had a taste of everyone's else dish and I wasn't impressed.  I ordered the Seafood pan roast. Okay, so I may be bias but I am IN LOVE with oyster bar pan roast so my exceptions were probably a little too high. But the flavors just didn't not go well. The soup had a sweet creamy taste to it that I didn't recognize. The seafood that was in it was just not up to par. Just basically lots of clams and a few fish chunks. The rice, I don't even know what kind of rice that was. It defiantly was not the typical rice I'm used to.   My friend got the Gumbo. She never had gumbo before so she thought it was good. But the flavors just was really off. Even the waitress said she didn't really like the Gumbo. I agree with her.   My other friend got the Philly cheesesteak and the meat came out extra dry.   The beau got Steak and crabs. Now that was pretty good. I actually ate most of his crabs. I love crabs with extra lemon butter. That was amazing. The seasoning on the steak was different though, it had a Mexican feel to it kinda like carne asada. Wasn't bad just different.   The drinks were ... Alright. My friend had to send her margarita back because it tasted like water. The 2nd margarita wasn't any better but she got it blended and didn't want to complain anymore. The waitress was pretty nice though very helpful.   Reviews raved about the 1$ oysters... Unfortunately I don't eat oysters!

gdxBN3eI6HbPT4mQ_c6o1g.text: We planned a family dinner here and double checked on line to make sure children were welcome. While it didn't specifically state that we could bring kids in, there was a children's menu posted so we foolishly assumed children were allowed. When we arrived we were told that the kids had to leave. When we asked about the children's menu they told us they just hadn't gotten around to taking it off the website. Since we were a large group and everyone had already arrived a couple of us just left with the kids. Our evening was ruined. We would never have considered coming had the information on the website been up to date.

kZKG1LpemXOzzU92l-AeBw.text: Extremely fast service. Nice environment. Had the spinach and crab dip it was amazing!

5ZdYXDqHJsRygEQ9HLJN8Q.text: My husband and I only come here for breakfast. It's inexpensive and the quality is pretty good. The ONLY issue is one of the waitresses, her attitude is awful! Not sure if she's just not a morning person or just not a people person. Not to mention she's super slow and forgetful even when no one else is in there. We've tried to sit up at the bar when we go just to make sure we get helped by someone else. Other than her, everything else is pretty good!

bE35AXbJDIZ5rVJaO-Zscg.text: Poor service. It wasn't even busy and we had to wait a while before finding someone to get us menus. Then another ten minutes before someone needed to be waived down to get us water. Then order.

zrXGIEV0tBYCuT4dzI_4pw.text: Food is always great...but service is poor :(.  Every time I go I feel I'm ignored???  Literally have to wave someone down for service and I sat right at the bar.   Of course I would understand if it was busy.  Went with my brother and sat at the end of the bar.  Maybe because we weren't at a gambling seat or because we look younger??  Not sure - still trying to figure it out. Sad because I do like the food!!!  Shoutout to the nice man who did offer to serve us finally -  I think I overheard his name was Rene.  He seemed happy to assist us.

2mF7WwbapULQbosSZY2-HA.text: I had the Tuesday Taco special. You can order any taco for $3. I had the Mahi Mahi, and shrimp. My fiance gave me a chunk of Tuna as well.  Get the Tuna first. It was cooked perfectly. The Mahi Mahi was also good, but you notice there isn't enough of the sauce on the taco.  The shrimp is the worst. It is chopped up pieces of shrimp that have almost no flavor. It is like chewy annoyances in a flour tortilla.   Please give patrons a corn tortilla option and put a little more sauce in the taco.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels still great.
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow, the calamari has gotten tiny.
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab stuffed tilapia.

m8MKz7sPYfb3bbiE3CTjDw.text: This place is great BUT if the bartender Doug shows up, LEAVE! He is the rudest a$$hole I've ever seen and doesn't care about you or anything else!

BqSPpyjm6FklSdzjFBArGQ.text: Just had the calamari, and it was dry and chewy. It tasted old, it seems like they changed the recipe to their calamari. Very disappointed, I will not be eating here in the near future.

FbIysCQ3prZEg5FoRKfijQ.text: First time going here my coworker suggest this place. I thought I would go with the sampler it would give me everything I had a taste for. So I got the fried shrimp, crabcakes, calamari and Oysters Rockefeller. Only thing I like was the shrimp. My calamari was way over cook hard to be exact, the first outer Rockefeller had no flavor l, and one was missing the oyster all together, the crab cakes wasnt nothing to write home about. My son had a pot with crab and peel and eat shrimp they where ok . Don't know if they where just having a bad in the kitchen . Won't be my first choice for a return visit

ZTg28DKDPICulV5JpEM6OQ.text: This place is AMAZING with late night orders to go!! My hubby works late and I had him go by TWICE this past week on his way home. (I'm sending him again tonight!! ) A lot of times when you order to go (especially late at night)...you know your food isn't very fresh but this place cares about their food and you can tell!!  Their Seafood Louis is so yummy! The lobster, crab meat and shrimp are fresh and the Louis Dressing is fantastic. The Coconut Shrimp was served with a coconut dipping sauce...it's delicious! If you want yummy seafood late at night...you should check this place out!!

BH-ezuljx9CAo1Dx5C5_aA.text: Well my dinner plans fell through somewhere else so my husband and I was driving around trying to figure out what to eat.....I didn't want TGIF or Chili's(you know...your typical chain restaurant) so I decided to Look on Yelp for a spot that had seafood and this spot came up. The food was great and our waitress was really nice. I was little skeptical based off the reviews but decided to try it anyway! I wish it was a little brighter because it was too dark it other than that it was good....will go again!

TRZFBqaBOUuIKNkvmZcx5A.text: Good music and bar food. Service can be spotty at times. Still the selection of drinks and food make it worth coming back.

VeoSYspytQwnh0GZ5O5wew.text: Many years ago we were at this restaurant and did not find it good enough for a return visit. A few months ago we ate at the Shucks on Flamingo and it was delicious so when our friends suggesting having dinner here on Saturday we were really looking forward to it. Unfortunately this one on Durango is not as good as their other one.  We ordered the New Orleans Oysters which we had also had at their other restaurant but these were not nearly as good. My husband had blackened catfish and I had the clams appetizer and we both found our meals very bland.   Our friends had the fish fry and they enjoyed their meals.  If we were to try it again we would go back to the one on Flamingo.

giPPFAzbJlxyu7HM1tszqA.text: My boyfriend and I are on a getaway date, staying at Mt. Charleston. Needless to say they messed up so we came back into town for dinner at Shucks. We sat in the dining room and Jeremy was our server, let me tell you I have never met a more friendly, courteous, outgoing server in my life and I work on the strip in the restaurant business! He definitely saved our date night, made amazing recommendations on what to order drink wise and food wise! Give this kid a raise and let him know you appreciate him. People like him are a rarity these day! Thank you thank you thank you Jeremy! We will be back just to see you!

AgxSAvWSv8f_O-2lgggoIg.text: My fave place of all time! Crab legs, oysters, linguine and clams...never disappoints!

w_eJ1LitgRXLEg26KNwh1A.text: Driven by many times but never Stopped until the Packers were playing the Seahawk's in the playoffs.  Felt odd since this is a Bears Bar but I knew it wouldn't be busy.   I went for the Shrimp Platter which had fried popcorn, butterflied coconut, and plain ole fried shrimp.  The coconut milk dipping sauce was my favorite part.  Everything was delicious we had the spinach artichoke flat bread. Yummy!  The beer choice was pretty standard with your common big 3 Bud, Miller and Coors.  The burger looked huge. The Big Mother Shucker! No just kidding it had a different name but something along those lines. I will give that a try  next time.  As well as some oysters that they are know for.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp combo platter. Delicious coconut dipping sauce.

g1D3-tl8WAMHyPdXkDbKPg.text: DON'T BOTHER!  This place used to be great. but in the last few months it sucks!  I have gone here for years & used to luv it.  I don't know if it is under new mgt or what, but gone completely downhill...I was there a month ago and usually order the steamed dungeness crab.  Whoever the new waiter is is completely clueless.  He totally screwed up my order, food was cold and tasteless.  The Mgr happened to come by & asked how everything was.  I let him know about the cluster mess  & he not only comped my meal, but gave me an extra portion to go,which I declined since I figured it would be just as bad!  I figured the waiter was having a bad day or just new, so let it go.  Well went back today since it is Friday & I like seafood during Lent & decided to give it another try.  Same guy was waiting tables & I was worried  & we sat down.  I don't know if he recognized me or what, but took 15 minutes to even come by to give me a menu.  We ordered and he even asked IF we wanted our appetizers first....HELLO? get a clue!  Well another 15 minutes go by & here comes some bus boy with the entrees! Needless to say, i was NOT happy, sent them back & told him I wanted our food in the correct order.  Another 15 minutes go by & out come they come.  My shrimp cocktail was luke warm & they were about the size of marbles.  The crab spinach dip my friend had was about the same temp and some kind of congealed mess with zero flavor & maybe they waived some crab over the top of it, but none was actually IN it!  I waived down the bus boy, sent them back & tried to get out inept severs attention once again.  You guess it, another 15 minutes go by & here come the bus boy with the main courses.  Again, luke warm  at best & the supposed "melted butter" was some kind of milky white watered down foam substance with zero flavor.  I told him just to bring the check...another 10 minutes and the waiter is back.  I told him I was here to give it another go & all the things wrong this time.  He said he would take care of our bill & I told him since we didn't eat it, that was a good thing.  I resisted telling the Mgr again about the repeat fiasco, but decided to write this review and NEVER go back.  I gamble there on a regular basis, so they have lost all of my patronage on both the bar & restaurant sides!

Efp1D4I77rVyk15bKLeiWw.text: When I first moved to the area, my roommate and I decided to go out for dinner.  He prefers chains.  I don't.  We settled on Shuck's.  Shuck's is a local chain consisting of three restaurants.  They have tremendous seafood, as well as sandwiches and meat.    I have been multiple times and I always am drawn to the clam chowder.  I also love the clam bake, and my favorite salad is the Shuck's Salad, consisting of Mesclun, a crableg, shrimp, and seared tuna.  Service is attentive and friendly.  If you are lucky enough to get Sonny, she is an amazing waitress.

R3_zxE11wcjtOl2l0EeijA.text: Alright, so I came here sometime around May of this year and it was alright. On my first visit, I had the rockafella oysters which I believe triggered my allergic reaction to shellfish. We sat at the bar and I had a lot of beer to drink... good times.  I ordered some chicken- type sandwich on my following visit which by the way was humongous and I was unable to finish it. Now this place is located in North Las Vegas so it's more of a hangout spot for the locals, there's nothing fancy or fantastic about it.

j6_UtaPSQu0B_m9jIE5uQQ.text: Great spot, good price and daily specials. They make some of their own sauces; the house made dressing is good. The ceviche is better than most in Vegas... They do it with some honey Dijon  sauce and salsa; bomb, if ur down for different flavor combos.

dvP0STzaY9s9p2M19le-wA.text: Shucks..a bit disappointed, last night I took family for the first time hoping to have the same experience as we did for about 10 times. The Clam Bake was the reason we always go on a Sat to have the $5 off, found that it wasn't anymore...crabs was an added option and you had to pay extra for it. It was still tasty but we should have gone to a buffet for the price we paid...It was still tasty though...Sadly..Shucks is now not on the top of my list..for value as the prices went up immensely...

7s9bcJl_VXgbS3qt9B2Nqw.text: Just wanted to start off and say the gaming at  this place is good got a four of a king And for the food it is awesome!!! seafood is hella  fresh and the bartenders are really nice  good place to kick it and watch the game or even go  to enjoy some great fresh seafood!!!

l-7dr7pZjTlBWLQ1E45sZA.text: The seafood here is very good, but the dish you really need to try is the black and blue salad. I'm not usually much for salad but this one blows me away. Romaine lettuce, grilled and sliced steak, blue cheese crumbles, onion straws and sun dried tomatoes make this one of the best salads I've ever had. Service is acceptable, food is very good.

PmSgOP0nrYt8TB3KnxpXXQ.text: Bland, boring, and slow.  Oysters were okay but everything after that was fast food like, without the fast.  Not much lunch trade and still wasted an hour there.

FAIEoEbddcrlZ7lXC9Zzaw.text: For $3.95 the breakfasts here can't be beaten.  There's around 12 selections... and they're all $3.95!  Everything arrives hot and cooked to order.  Coffee ($2.50) is good and not oily (a pet peeve of mine, I must admit)... although you'll smile that your drink cost more than half what your breakfast cost!  For lunch / dinner, the clam chowder and the fish and chips didn't disappoint.  Again, hot food prepared well.  It's hard to argue with simple dishes done well!  It's kinda smoky smelling when you first walk in through the door -- the lingering ghost of pre-ban times -- but don't let that put you off to trying this place out.  We used to be a fan of Joey's for FnC, but this place has really won us over by serving better tasting fare.

N1nT7_cdpdrFQiSPk6h91Q.text: My friend and I went here strictly because it was rated 4 stars on Yelp and is right next to his house.   We all know when something is rated 4 stars on Yelp that it is truly trust worthy and this place is no different.  The clam strips that I shared with my friend were some of the best that I have had yet and I am from New England.  My taste for seafood is pretty hard to please.  The service was great from the 3 different people that approached our table and they genuinely seemed to care.  Thats always a plus.  My main meal that I enjoyed was Fish and Chips and it was prepared wonderfully.  The only downfall is that this place is a Chicago Bear's bar, but it can be overlooked to enjoy such good food.  :)

5y23vXKCHc5KhpX9EHJ5kg.text: Best late night oyster spot.  Food is always great, super awesome oysters along with friendly bar tenders. It bums me out we don't have a place like this here in So Cal, but then again that means i cant burn it out, right?   I may be a little blind to what good oysters are, but it makes me smile and that's all that matters.

P_IEsfkeVudsu7bpMhUAsw.text: We were looking for a bar near home that serves food. I checked Yelp for this non-descript looking place with a cute name that I'd seen whenever I'd been to the shopping sector across the street. I was surprised to see all the good reviews, so we gave it a whirl. I just had a few beers (nice selection on tap) and the fried oysters. Delicious! Even the cole slaw was great. Everything about the place was SO much better than the boring old big chain corporate places with homogeneously stodgy fare. Everything except, that is, the smoking. I recently quit smoking so can appreciate that smokers enjoy smoking indoors, but I now find it rather unpleasant and have no idea how my friends put up with my stinkiness for so long (I must be really, really cool or something). Anyhow (I think I've just digressed...sorry!), the smoking is the only drawback I've found to this place.  Excellent quality food at a very reasonable price with good service, good atmosphere, and plenty of booze...what more could a cool girl like me ask for?! Looking forward to my next visit.

AT37vokoMKsIOEpKytkfjQ.text: a good place to catch a Chicago Bears game and food and service is pretty good as well.

_x-mBGCccdDroaKNALxIaA.text: Yummy! This is where I go when I crave American-style seafood. They have affordable prices and big portions for the money. I love their oven bakes the best which are usually good for two people and are basically seafood (mussles, clams, lobster etc.), potatoes, corn baked together. I love the intermingling of flavors and the freshness and the size!  The deserts are also great as are the drinks. The 24 hour part is definitely a plus just in case I am craving some lobster at midnight (has happened before).   I like the decor. It's simple, but effective. This place is rarely crowded, and seeing how I hate crowds, it's a major plus for me. The wait staff is very good.  I miss this place since I moved to SW part of the valley. I'd like to try the other Shucks closer to me, but this one on N. Durango is highly recommended.

wHGU7l7pYnJ6noKClAv1Jw.text: I love this on saturday mornings with a hangover. The food is good and the crowd is family. I wish the oysters were bigger

UDIM5dfM6MKEfVgnpqVhpQ.text: Absolutely LOVE this place. I go here every Tuesday night. The wait staff is pretty good. They have their on and off days (sometimes seem annoyed to serve you and other times they love you), but the food is CHEAP and SSUUPPEERR good! The buffalo chicken fingers and fires are to die for. I literally look forward to it ALL WEEK LONG. Can't wait to go back.

t6ST8funx1mBLh9XqEI7Ag.text: We used to go to Shucks pretty regular but the service got pretty iffy so we took a break. We decided to give it a try this past Tuesday night. We brought our 15 year old Grandson with us. We walked in, the sign said to seat yourself which we did. 1st a young girl walked out of the kitchen looked at us & giggled & went back in. a couple seconds later another young girl walked out of the kitchen looks at us giggles & goes back in. Now that we are a little weirded out another young lady walks to our table & tells us sorry we can't allow kids in here because they are having an issue with the health department because of smoking in their restaurant. Well it was nice of them  to embarrass us, would of been helpful if they either put a sign on the door or where you walk in near the sign that says seat your self. we could have done without the 2 immature girls giggling at us. Won't be going there or recommending this place anytime soon.

MyYQkMF-adD8gKaKxXO7kw.text: If you are looking for good sea food at good prices, this is NOT the place for you. This place was disappointing.  The clam bake lacked...everything and costs a lot. Had I not added crab, I'm not sure what I would've eaten. The waffle fries were good, but you can get very similar ones at your nearest fast food restaurant. The service was slow and awkward. I'll probably go home and have a bowl of cereal...if you have a hankering for sea food, going to this place will surely take it away from you. We will never go back.

kLY07qfSFmU9N3_MWRvHOg.text: Stay away. This place serves you 12 ounces of beer and charges you for 16 oz...

PVm081_6ckWAH9ufQG22Pw.text: The only reason I don't give them 1 star was because the food is decent (especially the breakfast) but as far a service goes for the dinning room it's terrible. The servers are not welcoming at all and act like we are impeding on their day. This place used to be a great place to bring the kids for meals, but not anymore. They only have 2 high chair for the entire restaurant and when you bring kids in somewhere its best to serve them first (drinks and all). Everyone at my table got drinks and my almost 2 year old was the last one served. Not happy with the experience at all!!

mn0H2yIil5nlwYpGN2r1Zg.text: Shucks has a couple appetizing items on the menu, but for the most part the food is overpriced and far from authentic.  The service can be a crap-shoot in terms of speed and getting correct orders.  But I have nothing bad to say about the atmosphere of the place.  Not saying I wont be back, but its low on the list

Zoch2GFsEDgR9IVrXrSWPQ.text: Gave this place another try and yet again was a huge BUST! Started with the appetizer Crab and Spinach Dip... TASTELESS is an understatement. Decided to try there "Friday Fish Fry special" and the fish was a total soggy mess. Literally falling apart and dripping with grease. I explained to the waiter my dissatisfaction and returned the plate. I was still charged for the meal even after returning the uneaten excuse for a meal. Never again

UQUlQ1r9ND9axoO2X9zx9Q.text: Awesome bartenders and the food is amazing!

k_YE5uGyYvODccztYZxD7A.text: Love their food and they have great bartenders!  We went in to have breakfast and sat at the bar to play, but wish they would not allow cigar smokers.

m0zDNp2Hy24BU99WY5IHTA.text: Waited 15 minutes before a server acknowledged us. Foods ok but not good enough to make up for the crappy service...

8cAbE-2RFCFM1Bs9fZ42eQ.text: My most recent dining visit to Shucks will probably be my last. It is very concerning to read some of the other reviews around the under-cooked "seafood".  I have placed "seafood" in quotes because I ordered something with "lobster" in it and the  taste was off - very different. I was up all night getting sick.

BVas7cp3JQebgtKzoUux5g.text: The food was excellent, but the service wasn't my favorite. We walked in and waited a good 10 minutes for someone to take our Order. WE even had to ask for a waiter. No one payed any attention to us throughout our time there. I hope next time the service is better to enjoy with the food.

OymYS-fI2_hOkovh_zNhsw.text: Agree with the John Taffer comment, I think we encountered the dumbest and laziest bar staff in Vegas. A crowded bar with a lot of unhappy people. So sad we just got up and left  Don't waste your time or money.

auqz-4rq8LGWMOg_pG5b-A.text: I am a real oyster lover. Like, LOVE LOVE LOVE oysters. Ask my Yelp companion Tetsuro P. I can pack those suckers away. I can eat a bunch of them in one sitting. Often times, I have joked about how I should do a competitive eating contest. I think I could take the women's oyster trophy home. But that's a whole other review.  I have always called T.P. up and asked to join me for oysters. He usually says yes, so I guess that makes us "oyster buddies." Mind you, I usually make this decision VERY late at night (or early in the morning, depending on how you view it). I think it's cool that even though he's not as big of an oyster fan as I am, he still comes along.  The main reason for this (besides the LOVELY company, lol) is the HAPPY HOUR here. It starts late at night (I think maybe 11 or midnight, not 100% sure), but it's worth it!! All the raw oysters are $1!!! Many appetizers are between $3 and $6!! I can eat my fill of oysters, and not go broke! It's heaven for me.  The bartender who is usually working late is a pretty cool guy, and both he and the older cook in the back now remember us. One time, the cook even came out to deliver my oysters! I guess he had  to see me for himself. He was probably expecting some huge, obese chick, based on how many I always order LOL!  I have never been here during the day, but they have a full menu and serve lots of other things besides oysters. So far, everything I have had here has been pretty decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna and lamb
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y99M4L30DnLcsMHxh2ZzwQ.text: I would not come back here. The service was friendly and timely, but other than that, this place is not notable.  -drinks were average and rather expensive for what was served ($6 for a well drink at 3pm on a Sunday afternoon?) -oysters (we ordered a half dozen) smelled fishy and didn't taste fresh -crab cakes were average and $10 for only 2 small ones

nACdOHH6Wq1idQGfMEN53A.text: Eh, it had it's good and bad qualities. In the mist of my bar hopping I came across this place. Keep in mind that I've actually never eaten crab before. Oh yes, this gets stupid.  When I first walked in I wasn't given a greeting, I'm assuming cause they probably thought I was some middle school kid that wandered in lost. The spiderman backpack I had probably didn't help. Oh well, my problem.   I pop a squat up at the bar, away from some obnoxious other patrons. That's right, I knew they were obnoxious the first 5 seconds I walked in. Kinda sat their awkwardly for four minutes. The other two bartenders ignored me. Thought I was waiting for mommy to finish her beer perhaps? Most likely. Could have asked though, you big jerks!   Finally a young lady came out and greeted me with a menu, I already had my ID ready (good job following the law!) and after a few minutes I ordered a beer and the crab bucket with a mix of the two types. One, cause I don't know the difference and decided if I'm going to fuck this up, I'm going to completely 100% fuck everything up!  They brought me out all the wrecking tools used to annihilate the crab legs, and I had no idea what to do. I played creeper and watched the guy a few seats down from me work his magic and then just tried to copy him. Could have I asked the waitress? Don't boddle me with your logic!  While it was good, I must say crab is not my thing. I'm one lazy ass bitch and sitting there for half an hour to get a handful of meat is not on my to-do list, but might be a good way to starve off the fat bastards we have on our planet. Seafood for everyone!

yiKnym9J05HBWzpN6gzJTA.text: I like this place. Both locations. All is good. ALWAYS. Not top quality fish but for what it's worth it's good. The staff is friendly and always happy to help. I go with friends, I go with family. No problem bringing the kids. It's always a pleasure.

HBOFwJG_CzXXVOJGmOhZ7A.text: Shucks is a solid place and always has been ( since i first went in 2007) I havent been to this location though, and to my surprise it was quality all around. Thursday happy hour 1$ oysters are a great deal although I must say, whoever shucked them, did so upside down... smh. Meaning the oyster was served on the flat (lid ) side of the oyster rather then the cup like side so there was no place for the oyster liquor (natural tasty broth) to go. Besides that I ordered a fried oyster po'boy and criss cut fries that were more then ample, served quickly and cooked to perfection. If you find yourself having an oyster fix one of these nights, i would for sure hit this place up. I mean, some times you just want a pint and some oysters after a late night, ya know? Well, i know I do.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They shuck their oysters upside down.. no oyster liquor :(

NJGSWiATI-dszPnHBwRrwg.text: I literally walked in and out of this place. There was no one to help us be seated at the front to the point that we had to search for the host/waiter even though the place was dead.  Did I mention this place REEKS of cigarettes? Like, really bad? I love seafood but I didn't feel like I'd be able to taste the quality of the food accurately here while inhaling clouds of smoke. I lost my appetite immediately and left.

q2lmEauiuxzsl5xaivTdmg.text: Came here since it was close to our house and pretty late... Got our usual Lamb Lollipops with the Honey Basil Sauce, Clam Strips and instead of Raw Oysters, I wanted to try Their Oysters Rockefeller....I should've read the description because they tasted like pizza with spinach and melted cheese on top, tasted okay, but I like my oysters with hollandaise instead of melted cheese. thats how I've eaten Oysters Rockefeller.....my bad for not reading the description thinking everyone else prepares it the same way.  we also got the fried cheesecake chimichanga and chocolate mousse cake which were okay. Next time I'll stick tothe raw oysters...ALOHA!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Mousse Cake
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chops with Honey Basil Sauce
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller

PCwc3c63PmPY5bcHs42Awg.text: I'm giving this 5 stars for one reason; I love Florida style fried shrimp and this is the only place in Vegas I've found that has it like I like it. I would come just for the shrimp.

Rh2mkxdbH8lmj_DyMxNzFw.text: This place is amazing! I don't post unless I receive extraordinarily good service/food or extraordinarily bad service/ food or whatever it may be. Therefore I post very infrequently. Shucks is where I always go when I get a craving for seafood or any kind of fish. Their food has never disappointed. However tonight stands out and I have to post. I live approximately 10 miles away. When I arrived I told the bartender Brooke, that I wanted to get some food to go and a drink while I was waiting. And then I realized that I had forgotten my wallet. I informed Brooke of my dilemma. I have never met her before and I am probably more than twice her age. She told me to order what I wanted and she would cover me until I got home and called her back with my card info so I wouldn't have to drive all the way back to pay! Now who does that? Thank you Brooke! Great service, great food, five stars!

-zdiTEVGJ3Y_NMPZGSr6Tg.text: I ordered a one pound burger It was the biggest burger I've ever seen I ate the whole thing very yummy service was ok

noyGQLGD4GOcv65TgwwWfw.text: Great place for a late night snack or drink... Izzy is an awesome cook and the bartenders at night are simply awesome... Everyone in the graveyard shift is friendly, kind and funny. Love this place and will comeback time after time.

nUbF9bfEDXlM_MvYjG3ocg.text: Being from Seattle I know seafood! And if you have ever cooked lobster you know it turns WHITE! And this place serves translucent lobster! When getting a reply from the server he said that's how it is.....So gross, hoping my man and I don't end up sick!!

eRm4y3JRb770EsTEvmVlQQ.text: Excellent food! It was our first time eating here last night. We sat in the dining area, so I cannot comment on the bar. The server was nice and kept checking on us, and filled my tea before it was even half empty. The place was nice and clean and smelled great! Our food didn't take too long to come out, and we tried lots of seafood! Between the scallops, clams, mussels, oysters, and calamari, we couldn't decide what was best! This is our new favorite place, and will definitely be back with our whole family!! Whoever the cook was last night is an excellent chef! Thank you Shucks!

yuw5JZTZ-DuPNuHzreBRAg.text: Great chicken tenders! Great service too, and very reasonably priced. Although unfortunately, the "butt burner" sauce wasn't very spicy

FTIVLK6JxiPIAk6h-0PXQQ.text: I didn't get the waiters name but he was awesome and very welcoming. It was our first time there and the service and food were good! I live close by so I will be back

a-xhQ4pchF2VQLMuEu4ivA.text: Great food, but the place is so dirty that I may not come back.  When they bus the tables, all they do is wipe down the tables.  The menus were sticky and filthy....the ketchup, malt vinegar and hot sauce bottles were filthy.  It's a hide turn off when the menu is so nasty.  It's too bad too, because the food is great.
