I hope they consider stepping up their cleanliness.  Thanks  Brandon  (702) 787-5803 Bgat72@gmail  I appreciate the response from Schucks, and I will give it another shot. Like I said, the food was great.  Thanks

S7d7HG4QcDZSAPOl_zvZgg.text: This is the best bar to hangout if you want a stress free place. Staffs are very friendly yet professionals. Food here is clean and always great! I love it here.

PEZpiVJkhk92AASTSVa8xw.text: We were told when we arrived that no one under 21 is allowed anymore because of a state law with smoking and gambling inside, however in a previous comment you stated that the location on Flamingo still allows children and had not changed their policy.  If you're telling customers the policy is due to a STATE law, isn't the location on Flamingo still in the same state?!?!?! Very disappointing.

XGKFJfwPSBPH0eRWKB54ag.text: EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK! Son got food poisoning here. And it lasted for days! He had ham and eggs and it was not good to begin with. As soon as he finished his plate, he started to feel funny.

2BbJDeFKJQNkWYRLrm9-3w.text: I've only been here once and hope to bump up my rating as I plan on coming back. Shucks is very appealing to me because its pretty close to my house, making it super convenient, AND they have a good mix of seafood as well as meat - very important factor for me because my sweetie hates seafood and I love it. Typically places that advertise seafood have either none or very few meat options. Shucks seems to have everything. Should be a match made in heaven, right? I thought so too but it did not go down that way. Fist, they had $3 margaritas on Tuesday - yes please! Margaritas were pretty good, deliciously potent. I decided to try their crab and spinach dip appetizer and went with jambalaya as an entree. The the dip had something sprinkled on top, which I assume was crab.. there were no other signs of crab, it was basically a spinach dip. The cajun jambalaya was supposed to have cod, crawfish, and andouille sausage - it had one piece of overcooked cod, probably 3 x1 inches with tons of sausage and some crawfish. The clod looked like was a side order. I was super confused why it came in one piece on the side and why that was all the cod that was in there... The biggest problem I had with the jambalaya is that it was SUPER salty. I am a salt loving gal but this thing was all salt. I couldn't really eat it.  My honey, however, enjoyed his wings and fries. He is a wing snob and is very particular about his wings. He only gets wings from two spots in Vegas. Well, he like the wings here! He got them medium. His french fries was delicious too, I can attest to that :) Though I did not care for my food, I plan to come back and try other things off the menu to find what I like. I really have high hopes for Shucks!

pxfExuMktv9BP50kb6fXmQ.text: I ove this place , the food is excellent and the service is on point love it . I moved away but i still drive ro the place because im married to the place   THANKS FOR BEING A GREAT PART OF THE COMMUNITY .

kelJqvew7rb_382MaOIfGg.text: I've been coming to this location for a few years and have always been extremely happy with the food and the service. They have a nice bar area and then booths and tables. I usually always grab a booth because when I come here I'm so hungry I want to order a few things and it all doesn't fit comfortably on the bar.  We have had the exact same server for over a year now and he's great. Brings us our waters and beers quickly and keep them refilled. All the staff is pretty awesome and friendly and makes sure to never forget you.   My foodie date and I were starving so we started off with the crab and spinach dip. I personally do not like the pita chips it comes with so I had them switch it to tortilla chips instead. Always a favorite. Then we also ordered  the calamari this time. This was the first time ordering that appetizer here and I have to say that was some of the best calamari I have eaten anywhere in Vegas. It was so light and crispy that I savagely ate the entire plate by myself. If you come here definitely order that.   Now on to the entrees! I think I have tried almost everything on their menu now but the Steak and Crab is by far my favorite. It's a flat iron steak( seasoned perfected) which is delicious and 1/2 pound of crab. The steak is always so tender you can cut it with a fork and my crab was exceptional. Huge pieces of meat that didn't even need any lemon or butter because it tasted so good on its own. They were out of my favorite sauteed summer squash side so I got broccoli instead. My date had the new Clam Bake( I think that's what it's called..?) which was amazing! It had a generous amount of clams, andouille sausage, corn, snow crab, and these deliciously seasoned potatoes. Not only did I eat all my food but I ate part of my dates as well. Haha it was just extra good.   Even after all that food I had to have some desert. Their cheesecake and brownie is to die for but I decided on the fried cheesecake and let me tell you I wasn't disappointed!   2 appetizer, 2 entrees, dessert and soda/beers our totally bill came to $85 which I thought was very reasonably for seafood and steak. Great place and if you are a sports fan they always have the games playing as well.

QLSjVyx90A1cgleZwdwi7g.text: Ordered the fish and chips for lunch. Food was great! Would've given 5 but upon entering the location the wait time I feel was too long to be seated(I know they saw us).Ordered food pretty quickly but the wait time for food was pretty much my lunch hour lol. I know it's not fast food but getting there at 12 and eating near 12:45 was redonk. Especially since it wasn't that busy. But hey sacrificing a little time for good food is worth it.

GBb8C2Sfsw2R0tyPLrJF2A.text: I like the friendly and personable staff, their Menu, and the fact that Classic Rock and Roll is played as you enjoy your meal and company.

g6D2FhXVRmkZ5yt_ZUQyAg.text: Ordered the clam strips and 1/2 lb of snow crab with old bay seasoning. We ended our meal with chocolate cake. Everything was delicious! Definitely will be back to try more things on their menu.

ZAjSMT4pU9zAjO0ygEI-3A.text: Our whole family has been coming here for years. Sometimes with the kids and sometimes without. We took our granddaughters there today for lunch because their mom is in the hospital across the street. We walked in, sat at a table, and after about 10 minutes of waiting for menus and the girls telling us how excited they were for their sliders, and happy to see them smile after such a stressful beginning to the New Year, a waitress walked up and said kids weren't allowed in there. Fine....you changed your rules. But someone could have approached us when we first came in and not 10 minutes later. Smooth move people. We are definitely former customers - there are about 12 of us that used to frequent there. The way we were treated on such a stressful day definitely proved that this establishment does not deserve our money. We will be talking about this to everyone we know.

0nBwGuZCxfwrCeRUjZ6uPQ.text: DONT FIX WHAT ISNT BROKEN! My wife loves this place bc of the seafood! I myself don't eat seafood and have LOVED (past tense) their burgers and sandwiches! So of course I ordered a burger tonight and I could tell right away something was off. My wife thought I was just complaining to complain so I asked if they changed their beef patty. Sure enough they DID in fact change their beef patties. Not as thick, juicy or as flavorful. Also hard to cook a burger medium rare with these new patties. The waiter said they were playing around with the menu and trying new things out. Don't think I will order a burger there again unless they go back to the old patties. Which is a shame bc I don't eat seafood. This was a great compromise restaurant for when she was craving seafood. I'm sure we will go back bc my wife needs her seafood from time to time, but depending on what else this head chef has changed (assuming it's a new head chef bc I've worked in the industry and a chef doesn't just change beef patties like that unless the owner is cutting his budget) will determine on if this will still be our compromises place or not. My wife would probably give it 4 stars for the seafood, but I'm writing this and their new burger patties are extremely disappointing. Great serves. GO BACK to the way it used to be when the burgers were juicy and flavorful

zNl2jJ5uViJ9JUD5VHLjCQ.text: I really love the food here, the one issue I have, is their phone number does not work. I have tried to call to place an order for takeout for lunch, but it rings twice and three goes to a dial up tone, it's super frustrating.

M-FB8F49gtGoISyR8aoIjA.text: Went to shucks for dinner and was turned away cause my daughter wasn't 21, they don't know what a loss they will take my family and friends won't go there anymore..... They care more about smokers than familys

mo-5ur-WZC8ToeVsJelXow.text: Went to Shucks for the express purpose of having oysters on the half shell. I ordered a half dozen. I lived in New Orleans and great Gulf oysters are available there year-round. What a disappointment at Shucks! The oysters were small and spindly and tasteless. One was so small I had trouble finding it in its half-shell.  I followed with the seafood bisque which was excellent but eat fast; it's best piping hot.  Realize that the two stars are for the quality of the oysters not the tavern. I first ordered a Heineken which was served in an ultra cold glass. It was most welcome. The bartender was very friendly and my waiter was attentive and friendly. The tavern itself was not smoky.  There are four TVs placed in such a way that only a few can see them well. There was only one broadcasting a live baseball game, the others, sports history  (I watched rerun of Super Bowl XVII, Balt (34) vs SF (31), still exciting). All-in-all, the tavern is a pleasant place (early Sunday evening) and well run. It was just the oysters that piqued me.  After going to Shucks I'm wondering whether a restaurant can advertise itself as an oyster bar year-round in a desert city. Oysters are mostly seasonal unless one lives close to the source (such as New Orleans or Houston) so we here in the middle of the desert may not be able to get quality oysters certain times of the year. Just thinkin' out loud here.

DtFuB3NnH5MW3vZMXZGmcA.text: Courtney served our large group, and I was so impressed with her service! This is the best service we've had anywhere in a long time. She took care of everything we could have needed before we thought to ask, dealt with our complicated split check situation with grace, and refereed a rock-paper-scissors match when we couldn't agree who was paying. Thank you!

Kt1MD4n6jG99i5HDx4YeaQ.text: boss is an absolute asshole. food is horrible. the servers were good. drinks were alright. but the boss was HORRIBLY disrespectful

q3krB3zX_Wqfr1tPCVEVZA.text: I used to frequent Shucks at least once a week.  What I loved most about it was the GREAT food and Amazing prices.  It has since been a while since my last visit and I see that it has changed for the worse. Before you could purchase a 1/2 lbs crab dinner that included russet potatoes for $10.99.  Now, the price is the same, but you have to pay separately for the side of potatoes.  I would rather the price of the meal have increased than to be charged a la cart for each and every side item as if you were at a 5 star restaurant.  Then, to top it off, they charged me a "To-Go" fee.  That is absolutely absurd!

zxG8GnSXZIOr7TgCqQ20sQ.text: I can't even list any stars for this place tonight, but listed 1 since Yelp reviews require it. After ordering our first round of drinks (which a couple folks never even receiver theirs), we never saw our waiter again until someone from his staff went and got him an hour later.  I'm not really sure how you ignore s table of 12, but maybe he didn't like tips....just terrible service overall.

b72Qua9ZibHhQxaeU70I4g.text: My boyfriend and I discovered the little gem a few months ago.  We went the first time and it simply wasn't memorable.  The 2nd time with my parents was better.  But somehow the 3rd time we tried it we just fell in LOVE.  Its down the street from us so that makes it even better.  My man loves crab legs and theirs are amazing!  We come here about 2-3 times a month.  Yes its that good.  We simply order the same thing because hey if its not broken...(you know the rest) Start off with the chips and salsa.  For the main course: 1 pound of crab legs seasoned with lemon pepper.   The servers are awesome!  We pretty much have the same server each time.  Hey Vivian girl!  Other honorable mentions: crawfish, chicken tenders.

Gb7PClpQP79q2XFovy8gfA.text: Was here last night with my sister. We wanted a quick bite. I liked the decor of this place and definitely feeling the food here! We ordered the calamari which was cooked to perfection! And we ordered the Rockefeller oysters which were delicioso! And the mussels, reminded me of hot and juicy. We also ordered a couple drinks. And all of this was $50. I was very pleased with the pricing here. Well done. Definitely coming back here or bringing a friend !

kYaOh0yRkrymkc-Cxo0vuw.text: I have eaten here before and  it is always excellent.  Went in for a beer and a shot after work. The bartender was good, he described the specials that he had and served me quickly even though he had a full bar. Great customer service even to the two girls at the end of the bar that dident know what they wanted to drink (If you have ever worked behind a bar you know the type lol). This is a great place to grab food or just a quick drink.

Rs3r1Mp22IwAzA06fxUtKg.text: After reading such great reviews from you awesome yelpers, I knew I had to give this place a try. I looked at their menu and got so excited that I had to go that day. So I went to have a quick dinner with my bf last night around 9:30pm.  It wasn't too smokey or smelly inside, and it was a nice quiet day. We decided on the rockafeller oysters (6 per order) and they were delicious! Though the oysters were  bit small and it seemed there was way too much spinach for the amount of oyster, it somehow worked out! Great flavor.  And then we shared the ribs and shrimp combo. The ribs were great! Cooked perfectly and the sauce was yummy, it was a bit too saucy for me, but super yummy. And since I am a low-carber, I asked to sub the fries and slaw for a side salad. (Very fresh veggies). And we chose the garlic shrimp which was also delectable.  I must say, though, the server was a bit slow. He was the only one working the night shift and I guess he was tired, but there was only us and one other table...  I am going back Tuesday to try more yumminess. I will post pictures of the items I get! I'm excited to try their other stuff like the lobster fingers and clam bake and crab (which they ran out of when I was there)...  I highly recommend this place. I will probably make it a regular place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs and garlic shrimp combo

8qm8vM7F4G_ccGg6ZJPfkQ.text: Service here isn't what it was, but still a decent place. Prices are reasonable and the food is above average. Wednesday is buy one get one free on burgers and sandwiches .

twRPaVa8hF6TCmv1yjVwkA.text: I came here hoping to find great seafood near where I live. Unfortunately I didn't find it.  I started with some Oysters which were ok.  They weren't anything special and I wouldn't return.  I then had a combination platter to try several other dishes and was sorely disappointed.  The shrimp ceviche was bland and the only flavor that came out was the cilantro.  The calamari was overcooked so it was very chewy and the marinara it was served with was runny and odd tasting. The fried clam strips were over-battered and overcooked... the flavor itself wasn't bad but it was like chewing a tire.  The crab cakes didn't have any crab flavor, it was just an overpowering pepper flavor. All-in-all the service was fine and the people were nice so I have no complaints there.  Unfortunately most of the seafood is not fresh and I think this is the biggest reason why most of the food is bland and tough.  Granted its tougher to get fresh seafood in Vegas but the quality of the food is so low I won't be returning.

XYbml20cqrQ6XM5HGvOrIQ.text: Very good food and great service, definitely my favorite little getaway :) didn't get the name of the waitress but she had a red bow ;)

zjZJd2Fzj3yrtruLsWoNEQ.text: Don't get the carry out cat fish. Under cooked not crispy at all. Cold frys. Big hunk of fish sitting in grease. 21 usd for that with 4 shrimp which were over cook. Sorry.

gQ-47-wK3124tMbeX8Hirw.text: My fiance and I decided to try Shucks the other night.  We pass by it all the time but had never been there before. Overall, it wasn't bad. The service was good, the beer was good, and the atmosphere was good. My fiance had clams and New England clam chowder and she loved them both. As for me, I had the Texas oysters. There are supposed to be prepared with tequila, lime, and Tabasco. Sounds pretty awesome, right? Well they had no flavor. I also had the crawfish appetizer. They were pretty good and came in quite a big portion for an appetizer. Since we both like seafood, we'll probably be back. I'll stick to crab legs for next time

xAft3NTuS2eMynohhYhTtg.text: So our first time coming here was a pretty bad experience. My husband, and brother in law, and myself were in the mood for some seafood, and decided to give this place a try after seeing some of the good reviews on yelp.  When we first walked in we werent really greeted, so we just found an open table (that wasn't covered in old dishes that hadn't been bussed yet). About 15 minutes later we had a servicer come take our drink orders. After about another 15 minutes we were able to order. My husband ordered a crab bucket, his brother a shrimp bucket, and I Ordered a shrimp poboy. We also got two appetizers the calamari and the clam strips.  The calamari was burnt to a crisp, like crack your jaw and slice up the inside of your mouth burnt crisp. And the clam strips were more like fat little clam chunks, I've never seen them cut up that way. And they were very tough. Unlike the calamari they were at least edible, unfortunately there were only like 4 clam strips on the plate. All together the appetizers were very disappointing.  By this time we've long been out of water. And couldn't seem to catch the attention of the 2 servers that were rushing around past our table. Finally when our food was brought to us (maybe other 15-20 minutes had passed) we asked the server who had brought the food for some refills, and tried to place an order for a drink. She kind of stared for a few seconds then repeated the drink order and said alright no problem and seemed to be off to put the drink order in and bring refills. We never saw her or our drinks the rest of the night.  The food we ordered was ok. The portions for the shrimp and crab buckets were very small. Both meals came out in small bowls, with an empty bucket to throw the shells away in.. so I guess that's what the bucket part is about. Which is very misleading. All in all it was not a good experience. I'm not sure if we'll be coming back here. It's a shame too because we really wanted to like it since it's so close to our house.

GF1sGeTf_2B8HLH5xuQacQ.text: Great place to blow off steam, have some great beer, and great food.  This place is legitimate. Great for watching games too!

Hz_OdvhPSVt2VKubI_CU1w.text: Great place. Love the flat iron steak. For price for the quality, plus it's always tasty and cooked to the right temp. The scallop appetizer is a steal, especially the Asian one with rice and vegetables. It's really entree sized.  The lamb chop t-bones are always my favorite. You get 3 per order.

L7TZsmlsAQloqF2dDgmtfw.text: I am giving this place one star due to fact that on arriving there was a sign stating no one under 21 was allowed in the building despite the profile on Yelp stating the opposite.

ZKtnL2a2voQ5EB4aL_AqWQ.text: Went in for breakfast and found that their portions are plenty! They have great selections for right under $5 and I got a steak and egg breakfast for around $8! Amanda, our waitress was very attentive and was able to predict out needs. Great service. Great chill and cheap place for breakfast and it's beyond worth it. Can't wait to come in for dinner! Plenty of TVs for games, fun drinks, and a great seafood/ drink menu. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halloween drink options.

SjUxKpJUrpzk0_B8Ffvjqw.text: This place is within walking distance to my new place so of course I had to give it a try :-) I'm so glad I did! The food is good...I mean I was shocked how yummy the bar food was! A million tv's to watch whatever sport game thats on....fyi it's all about the bears in here though. I kinda only really care about watching the SF Giants play baseball, niner fan by default...but football I really watch for kicks and giggles no real loyalty so I'm not offended at the all Bears stuff ;-)   Anyways back to my point...the food is wonderful! The food is good, prices are great and well, they remembered us when we come back :-) and I have a soft spot for any place that remembers their repeat customers...as we left they even offered us a water bottle to go :-) Kudos people! Love the place, love I can walk to it, love I can chill have some drinks and walk my bum back home :-)

XzHSiQgBrHOgTjuXDxYVQA.text: My family and I always eat at the other shucks location and the food and service is great. We came here because we were on this side of town and I don't know if it has a different owner or what but the service was horrible and the food was worse then bad. I hate to leave such a negative review but I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

gB4eLXGtQEZFjY2mdExjjg.text: Stopped by today for lunch after deciding against Krazy Sushi and I have to say it was a GREAT decision. It was a little pricey but everything was so good! Started with oysters on the half shell... They were perfect! The had the chose 4 and did x2 on the peel and eat shrimp, the Rockefeller oysters, and the calamari. Everything was great! The calamari had just the right amount of breading to not be overbearing and was fried perfectly! My lunch was so yummy!

drQ9Jr0WIL02f6YfCoAUPg.text: Centennial Hills is a gastronomical wasteland.As a result with few decent places to chose from, Shucks becomes a standout. Keep it simple and basic. Their soup especially the Lobster Bisque is quite good. So is the clam chowder. Burgers are good too. I also am fond of the quesadilla.Entrees are a bit pricey so I would not recommend them. Salads especially the black and bleu.This Salad with bleu cheese crumbles and plenty of slices of steak, prepared the way you like it, perhaps is the best menu choice.

tdvRpeTvtQG1yeyD4Prbbw.text: Tonight was not a great night at this Shucks as the Cigar smoke got to us as soon as we walked in the door. We went to a booth but still had to move farther back. The fish fry was not as good as a normal Friday as the fish was very Greasy and the cole slaw so dry that even the waiter agreed but did nothing to correct it. Going to stay away as this was our Friday nite fish spot but we are going to try some other places.

5lzPFW5whWIKlmHHJYSLaw.text: Love the oysters here they also have a really good shrimp platter I loved the coconut shrimp has a good friendly atmosphere one of my favorite places to go watch the football game

i_dwF3Ls3HQ8DVZXfqgiGA.text: Love everything about  the place!  Alway have the best service,food, and drinks. Special  thank u to brooke and all the staff members.

RzZRMm6JaABNBnK-TyaXcg.text: The food was better than average. Would come back if I needed food late at night. The pieces were good and the staff was friendly.

hmclBcFT3XNfjlPLdhLPAw.text: Who says the food deals are dead in Vegas? Shucks' entire breakfast menu is $3.95 and you really can't do better than that.  I had Shucks Breakfast:  2 eggs, choice of ham, bacon, sausage, brunch potatoes and toast. My dining partner had the Chicken-fried steak breakfast.  I had a bite and it was really good.  As other reviews have mentioned, coffee is $2.50 which nearly doubles the cost of breakfast, but it's still cheaper than Denny's!  Highly recommend this place for breakfast.

NmqO01nPTPmWcRK0qA-F5w.text: So, this is a bar. For anyone that might be confused (we were). We thought we'd found a cool local seafood joint, but no. They even have a kids menu. But it's one small room, half is a bar and half is booths. The "bar" is smoking, dining area is non, but there's absolutely nothing dividing the two. So you'll be breathing in smoke while you eat. Not good for kids at all. This is not a family place.

pBJW68-YU2RQLfIa4f-8tA.text: As The Great D-Barns Would Say "Best Hidden Gem In Vegas",  GREAT Prices/Food & Service...

7VDWZ8WpHZXcypNs5VXgoA.text: Ordered the cornmeal battered catfish. It was served raw. The fish was undercooked and mushy. To say the food is like New Orleans is an insult to actual New Orleans food. I'll never waste my time or money going back.

G85gd6EaeuI4GatJmLdrkw.text: Stopped in tonight at my local spot. It is Saturday. There was a full bar and only one bartender on shift. I never had to ask for a drink and neither did anyone else, Brooke is a rockstar ... 21 people at the bar and a full lounge . All Pistons firing ! Great food and even better service !

y0fOli0Er4p0mJq8nDWXpg.text: Was here again during a Bear's game. I mentioned in my last review that I didn't care for their raw oysters--they didn't taste very fresh. Well, put those babies in a shooter with some vodka and bloody Mary mix and they are not bad at all. They are normally $5 but during Bear's games they're only $2.

7O9YGsAH9YHzE9nowUcHqA.text: It's a really great place for seafood, especially late at night when all other options are closed.  It's nice to have a place like this in the Northwest area of Vegas, because it's still up and coming and the pickings on good restaurants aren't exactly numerous.  I had a daily special, and to be completely honest, I thought it was great.  The fried fish was soo good. Crispy on the outside, yet still tender and soft on the inside.

B-J3IolXPw0Pz-tByIMCRQ.text: Surprisingly, a pretty good seafood restaurant.  Lots of regular bar food, but also a lot of shellfish and seafood on the menu.  Staff was decent, friendly.  The menu is kid-friendly but the bar is not really separated from the eating area (it's all open, not separate rooms) so depending on how busy the bar is, it might be a little smoky for little ones.    No military discount, but if you need seafood and don't want to brave a casino or downtown, then Shucks is a great alternative.

fua8_l83JzKRLYTQs62WWw.text: a seafood joint less than 2 minutes from my house in a neighborhood filled with chain restaurants and their kitchen is open 24/7 with daily and graveyard specials? this pescetarian is as happy as a clam at high tide!  =D  i must admit, i had low expectations of shucks on my first visit. i'd read all of the reviews, some by people i trust implicitly, so i was willing to give it a try, at the very least. i was pleasantly surprised as the food was delicious and the service was friendly and accommodating. i ordered the scallop sliders which are prepared on hawaiian sweet rolls! imho, sliders should really only ever be served on hawaiian sweet rolls. the scallops were tender and flavorful and the wasabi sauce has a nice little punch! crunchy waffle fries on the side were yummy as well.  shucks has quickly become my neighborhood spot. i've since ordered several different items and i've never been disappointed. the mahi mahi is one of my favorite items on their menu.....prepared perfectly tender and flaky, served with wild rice and cooked veggies that are still crisp.  two of my biggest pet peeves:  1. overcooked fish 2. soggy cooked vegetables you won't find either of those here.  the prices are already extremely reasonable but the daily specials are where it's at. tuesdays - $3 tacos wednesdays - b1g1 sandwiches and wraps thursdays - $1 oysters  i'm so glad i gave shucks a chance and even happier that they exceeded my expectations in every way. i'm totally a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger miso glaze mahi mahi. Surprisingly moist and tender. Yum!
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop sliders on kings Hawaiian rolls!!!
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp po boy

Mq0hxJHzUyfnnw8WUycW_g.text: Whoa move over Joe's Crab Shack, Shuck's has been discovered. The first time I came here I wasn't sure about how the food would taste, but I am glad that I tried it anyway. I tried the lobster bites and the crab dip both delicious.   The second time I came here I saw a couple that ordered this big shell of seafood which was the clam bake. So my bf and I ordered it since it seemed like it would be enough food to eat. Of course it was...it has clams, crab, corn, potatoes, and sausage! MmMmM just the sound of it makes my mouth water.    Totally worth the place to go to eat some seafood and watch some games. Great location, clean, and friendly staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam bake... Perfect for two!

3gGN2PxajXaCzrA8wqiziA.text: Great food! Terrible...terrible service. Fabian saw us twice within an hour. Same problem last time we were here unfortunately.

r-ZHBLmgXdyXld8SClB-hQ.text: My mother-in-law is visiting from Hong Kong and looooooves raw oysters.  When I saw that Shucks had $1 oysters on Thursdays, I knew that I had to take her here.  My husband and I had treated her to Joe's Stone Crab the weekend prior, where she devoured really expensive, albeit delicious, raw oysters.  So, obviously the $1 oysters weren't going to even compare.    The oysters on the half shell were quite small, but perhaps I need to come on a non $1 each night, to see the True quality.  I also ordered a cup of the seafood bisque, and it was OK.  My in-laws ordered the clam chowder and they seemed to enjoy it.  By the end of lunch, the two of us ate 3 dozen raw oysters, and although they weren't the best I have ever tasted, it was nice knowing that we didn't break the bank to get our fill.    The service is friendly, but it is a little too smoky for my asthmatic lungs. We sat in the non-smoking section, however that invisible wall does not prevent the smoke from seeping into my air space.  If I wasn't so sensitive to the cigarette smoke, I would definitely return.  It is a fun atmosphere, and a great neighborhood bar for sport lovers and seafood fans.

poigCmpye_v8OAjptPbVBA.text: Would love it if you started offering Fanny Bay or Kumomoto oysters.  Dare I ask for Shibumis?  Doug, the guy who prepares the food latenight, makes the best crab legs.  Had to go for them three nights in a row.  The five stars are for the late night staff.

S3oizSrnX57cj9ESEELGew.text: Worst customer service ever! Took 45 min to order, you need more employees? Hit me up, I'm free.

cnrn8pBH9YJMEZM5_3SR6A.text: Ok neighborhood-vibe restaurant. Food was typical of a greasy spoon. Or maybe I'm just from LA and have higher standards. The oysters were just ok. Even those felt somewhat...'greasy'.

OKAyV3DgBcokYErSS8Iwxw.text: Love this place. The lobster fingers are beyond good. The beer is cold and the drinks actually have alcohol. I'd say this place has delectable breakfast, lunch and dinner. The slots are lucky and the staff are friendly.

WS072ZT8hPHicbT45FxLAg.text: A little smokey at times, but the food is good and service is great.  Definitely a neighborhood favorite!

H5gNsNsQ2yZc3zXMQL9VfQ.text: Was craving for crabs for weeks so my expectation was high when I came in here solely to try the snow crabs. Got 1 lb snow crab ($22). It was good and satisfied my craving. Only problem was one of the cluster was missing 2 legs... however,  when I pointed it out to the server they brought out another plate with 2 legs.  Why was it missing in the first place? The legs are the best part.  I wanted to wait to order oysters another time when it's $1 (mentioned by other yelp reviewers) and was informed they no longer have "happy hour". That was years ago.  Only special day for oysters now are on Thursday which is $1.50 each.    So I ended up ordering half-dozen which costs $10.99 ($1.83 each)  Didn't like it as the oyster liquor (natural juice) were all drained. Probably will not order it again as I do like to slurp in the oyster liquor with my oyster. That's what make it flavorful.   The New Cajun steak rigatoni also good but just a tad bit too saucy.   Do I recommend it? It's worth a try especially if you have seafood cravings.

q4jvw3EJnvJcuTu4uxMD9Q.text: Best sea food on Durango! I've tried a few sea food dishes and thoroughly enjoyed them; $10.99 for a half pound of snow crab legs, $18.99 steak and snow crab legs, served with mixed vegetables, and garlic mashed potatoes, $12.99 fish and chips, $15.99 for lobster macaroni and cheese, $9.99 for stuffed shrimp with crab, served with yellow rice and cheesy bread, $5.00 for lobster cocktail. Overall the service is quick and the servers are pleasant and knowledgeable of the menu!

tjvZNW7UXcUMfDHga3SInQ.text: We always loved to eat here since we moved to this side of town in 2013. My husband And I have been here in the evenings for date nights as well as with our boys for family lunches. Today we were turned away with our boys because apparently you now have to be 21 to eat here. This is ridiculous you are located in the Cenntenial hills are which is full of families. We will not be back.

MbSiSEMwzPSHPxeiKy-57A.text: I have driven by Shucks on Durango thousands of time in the last 12 years, but was looking for a lobster mac and cheese and saw they had the item on the menu. Open 24 hours there are a lot of nice booths and large open space, great bar area.   We ordered take out of a lobster roll, lobster mac and cheese and Jambalaya. The lobster roll $11.99 was HUGE twice the meat and a great taste, even came with French roll and $5 less than Maine Lobster. The mac and lobster ($15.99) was great, I could barely pry some away from the wife. A huge portion, easily feeds two hungry people. Same with the Jambayala I forgot to say rice and got the linguine instead. My mistake. But not too spicy which for someone like me with heartburn was perfect. You can always add hot sauce.  We ordered just before noon, got there 10 minutes later and our food five minutes later. Great service, friendly people and pretty smoke free.  Wife has already picked out our next takeout order next week. Probably will eat in as this is one of the nicest places in Las Vegas. Prices were just great, half of Red Lobster with huge portions.  Now if they would only add lobster bisque to the menu.

cfCDxp9CiW1e9rgYbqmEDA.text: I love this place, I get the half pound of shrimp and salmon entree and it's so good!!

kQcTqTRCTtMKcns68FSPjQ.text: LOVE this place. I get a variety of things on the menu and everything is always delicious. Had one bad experience here with customer service but it was immediately rectified, thanks to the wonderful manager Josh and the night bartender, I believe his name is Doug. Will continue to come here for my late night nacho cravings

yZHyEAC-UcpiiLLSYfW8JA.text: I was pleasantly surprised with Shucks.  The whole experience was great.  The food was delicious. It came out hot and fresh. The staff members were pleasant and attentive.  I tried the crab and the chopped house salad.  We were not disappointed. The cocktails were amazing.  The prices are reasonable.  I will definitley go back.

MDtV0FqHQqLp7qkCdt8rGA.text: Best Seared Tuna, excellent service, they have earned my repeated business. Thank you

HP6lKBM0MaX__FHjTw1Xbg.text: First time, but definitely not our last! Best ahi poke ever, and I've eaten a lot of poke! And never seen so many clams in one dish before as in the linguine and clams! Love the relaxed, slower pace (I wouldn't come when in a hurry), good music, and very friendly staff. Just can't recommend the bisque - very salty! But they were so nice about replacing it with something else without hesitation. Can't wait to come back - Especially on 1/2 price martini night!

WUehGBquR64XY0iFtHOr6w.text: This is a bar AND a restaurant.... BUT you have to be over 21 to even dine here... ridiculous. "You can order to go though?" Nope never eating here again!

eXaYtnIoEUaSUCFAD-C0QA.text: We love this place the one star is not because of them it's because some idiot brought her baby in and then complained to the health dept and they can no longer serve under21 ... Thanks to the rotten person who did this !!! This was the only place to get seafood in Centennial hills !!

-ukxtuxnxroubWiJt9IC_w.text: So far best place to go if you want a fresh hot catfish Po Boy. It's even better when you add cheese and ranch. Literally I will drive all the way over to this location just for one. My mom and I went here because she heard good reviews. I was not disappointed. It did take a while to get the food and the waffle fries aren't the best ever but they do hit the spot. Would definitely return

x0ywpwvG4xR1-fo4mc0H6A.text: Shucks is a great place to look for something to eat on a budget. The prices are fair and the seafood is amazing. The only item on the menu i didnt like was the mac and cheese. The cheese doesnt taste that great and has the mouthfeel of glue. But the steak nachos are amazing as is thr crab, crawfish, and tune poke. The wait staff is always timely and polite. It has the feel of a dive bar so maybe not exactly the place for a romantic night out but great for everything else

JcDJE4PreBxf53JqqtiRTA.text: I love coming here for breakfast. I would like to consider myself a regular. It's inexpensive & never have to wait to be seated like most breakfast places. The staff is super friendly. It is a bar but I come here with my family on weekend mornings, totally don't even realize I am at a bar. It's decorated in Chicago sports gear! So today, I noticed a new menu & the churro waffle is to die for. You don't even need syrup! Love it.

Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro Waffle is a must try!!
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Foster.

dY5l2nd2E4kf1aC91o-Bgg.text: The new menu was very nice and they even made me something from the old menu. Jeremy was an amazing and and attentive server!! Service was super.

S7AXZr-nNdSblktHZhM01w.text: Nothing but greatness from this place. Service = outstanding. Food = mouth watering. I've been to a few oyster bars and this is one of my favorite places. Taco Tuesday's are amaaaazingggg. Had bacon wrapped shrimp as well and it was delicious not overlooked and rubbery. They had different oyster shooters to choose from, which I found awesome because it was hard for me to find an oyster shooter to begin with.

VrUEiPQhnay78gUtKyDGEw.text: This place is awesome! Came here after work for some drinks, food and to watch some games. My friend and I both ordered a cup of clam chowder. It was really good. For food, I got the lobster salad sandwich with TATER TOTS. (Yay for tots!) My friend ordered the Philly cheesesteak sandwich with thin fries. The fries were regular sized, not 'thin'. Both sandwiches were good and  big in size. I took most of mine home with my friend's fries since we both ate my tater tots.  The service was awesome. All the servers were cool. It was awesome I ran into a bunch of my friends here, all here for the same reason!

mRh9yk1XdSRcrT5JYh_oDg.text: Our two families use to come here all the time, and we have two young boys that love eating here as well. They just changed it back to no one under 21. The owner needs to stop changing the rules. Pick one and stick with it.

o0KNmp79TIfs4wXV92allA.text: Best fettuccine in town always hottttt and the sauce is flavorful and amazing!!!! Crab or shrimp is awesome in fettuccine....friend oysters r good also

naW-Mf1dqUjcqnYGKqbzDA.text: Love this place...   Great happy hour specials and the two guys running the bar and kitchen are awesome. They never try to push you to order anything extra, they don't force you to hurry.. They are very laid back , attentive.. Never charged me for any extras or messed up our food.  You cannot beat their $1 oysters and their burger combo ( fries, cheese and mushrooms included) for under 5 bucks.   My brother tried the seafood omelette, and was impressed with the taste and the price.   The only thing is that they don't have the best beer specials, however that is easy to overlook with all the other great things this place has to offer.  We are going to come back every chance we get.. I'm looking forward to trying their regular menu.

xldEr_YhfMERN9LFjOyDzA.text: It's like that meal you eat when you're really hungry and all of a sudden your full and grossed out.  The crab and spinach dip was runny and simply not good.  It came with toasted flour tortillas cut in triangles.  The crab cakes were salty and full of flavors that shouldn't go together.  The Rockefeller oysters and fried shrimp weren't bad.  Garlic fries were greasy and salty.  Ceviche was plain.  Snow crab and peel and eat shrimp was ok.  My advice is stick to the bar and have yourself a beer.

zQGK-fEHvNrD2Mva-3T2zQ.text: Seriously, this place has an awesome cook! I try the fish and chips and my gosh orgasmic ;) so fresh and perfectly crispy. Also tried two tacos mahi and shrimp and guess what sooooo freakin bomb. I'm still craving that stuff in my mouth. And of course it's midnight and what do you do at midnight at shucks you may ask!!?? You attack the shit out of the $1 oysters raw or rocker fella oh em gee awesome !!  Btw the steak is delish just saying steak n eggs babay! Lol

lZz2z6QXv-PQg2s_elF1tg.text: Great bar food here and small but decent selection of beer.  It's pretty smoky in here though. Not sure why they continue to allow children in even though they have a 21 and over sign. There are kids in there every time. They should remodel if they want to be a family friendly place and care about their guests.

igdCJvE9-yh19E3imjHlTw.text: Music is always good - love the classic rock playlist.  Fish is mostly good for almost every dish on menu.  Most is fresh which is hard to filings in Vegas.  Marty bartender is awesome.  He came from Shucks on Eastern & Serene.  Tons of TVs.  Good local vibe.  My favorite dish is the blackened chicken tacos with their signature salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Solid wall of bar lights!

B2Z5nxfnAMXdd8wPTdY60A.text: My family and I went here earlier today. My mom is allergic to my cat (oops) and can't stay in the apartment for over 30 mins, so I couldn't cook her the elaborate Thanksgiving meal we had hoped for. Thankfully, Shuck's was open and they even had a special menu for the day and $1 oyster specials. The waitresses were SO sweet and kind. I kind of felt like the devil for going to a restaurant on Thanksgiving day but if I had to, I think Shuck's was the best choice.  The Thanksgiving menu was pretty generous, for $11 you got a ton of food and a piece of pie (pecan or pumpkin). The food was solid/good, I'd say their seafood is better than their Thanksgiving fare. Regardless, the fact that they were even open made me super, super grateful, because I don't know what else we would have done!

h88AoZAkyez_Z1u_LuvtRA.text: Best bar food ever. Reason for 4 and not 5 stars is it depends upon the staff. If Darby is bartending, the drinks will never be empty and the food will not sit in the window drying out. The man knows his sh*t and cares about his patrons. We all know this, so if the parking lot is packed he's probably working.. if it's empty you may wanna think twice lol.  I will sometimes call to see who's working. Cooks vary from 4star restaurant awesome to "dude really? did you even rinse these oysters before you shucked them?'... but for the most part food is awesome, low priced and I love coming here.

tPzPkdmX3A9fN8gfnhcHyQ.text: Crab legs here are simply delicious. I love this place, it hasn't failed me. & they're 24 hours! If you want a crab legs and oysters and a nice beer this the place. They even have seafood benedicts! I always go for the raw oysters and dungeness king crab legs with potatoes and corn.  Making my mouth water writing this lol

S59VxLS42M9ZsqOzbNQPRQ.text: Food was horrible my husbands fish wasn't all the way done. Oryster shots was horrible for the price not worth it. This is my first and last time going to shucks tavern on Durango. Not to mention we kept having to wave down there server

dklAKBB-5-ckbiSdcTIWXw.text: I love seafood therefore I love Shucks. Great fresh seafood priced non-Strip. To those negative reviewers here I offer them some sage advice. Don't go to a seafood joint for burgers or steaks. For god sakes this place is known for its great seafood. If you love seafood you'll love Shucks.

62QKdc8Bswwri89hyj7b8A.text: Came here to meet up with friends. We just wanted to eat, drink and catch up. Sorry to say I don't know our servers name, but he knew we were there to talk and enjoy  the company.  We ordered round after round of appetizers over a three hour period and he was great.  The oysters were so good, we ending up getting three dozen by the end of the night. Most places like to turn tables quickly, but they were patient and courteous with us. We asked for tortilla chips for the dip because one of our group could not eat the flour chips, which have a great spice sprinkle, with the amazing crab dip, and their response was immediate.  The shrimp ceviche was fresh and flavorful. Mussels had a fantastic broth. Thank you for an amazing night.

IsWSy8aIMXMDARbvPwr_Hw.text: I went down to pick up an order to go, the food was not ready when expected so I took a seat at the bar and ordered a glass of wine. Very local atmosphere but customers and bartenders were telling dirty jokes with the language to match. It was enough to make me uncomfortable.....The food was OK but I will not return. Not a family friendly place.

WP34ddhTe5iUlCBJ71SarA.text: One of the better seafood restaurants in the northwest part of town. It's was a buy busy and took about 15 minutes to receive our drink order, but the waitress was consistently checking in on us and was very polite. Great place we will definitely be back!

QscORFlWhw4iMG-apQE21Q.text: Been here several times.  Love crab and oysters. Last visit was Friday the 7th the entire visit was a disappointment.  Service was slow, inattentive and rude.  Oysters smelled and were not fresh.  I ended up paying for eating 2 of the 6 for a few days. What a shame! I've been here before and loved it

uaFloBdmSzRim8mYQBBjJw.text: Had the opportunity to enjoy a lovely breakfast here this morning. Honestly I wasn't expecting much but it ended up being a really great meal the potatoes were nicely seasoned eggs and bacon cooked perfect. The pancakes came out nice and fluffy but I didn't like that they only had the heinz syrup in the packets yuck. But the decor was nice and warming even though it was a Bears based theme being a packers fan that was kinda rough lol all that aside I like this little place very cozy and welcoming. Lastly I would like to say the service could use a little help I'm sure that because it was early not all the servers were there and maybe they were stretched thin but 30 min to get our card processed was just too much and it's not like the place was packed full also I would not recommend a bloody Mary here very thick and concentrated was not a highlight of the meal at all.

GmfzUzZMAmBfx_q-2g0aJA.text: This is the only place I have ever been to that charges a to go charge . Which is so totally absurd. I called in my order, went to pick up my order and I notice the charge. The girl told me it is a to go charge. They charge you 50 cents for every container they put your food. Then I got home and they gave me the wrong food. I will never go back. Fuck them bitches!!!!!

XR6Q4pZ0bRbYx3KqRbNeVg.text: BEWARE THE GRAVEYARD MENU.  Typically I have a great meal and time at shucks. living close by I have been there quite a few times. Last night a buddy and I shared some fried clam strips and peel and eat shrimp. When the clams arrived the first thing I thought was "what the hell is this?" I have never seen clams that were almost 5 inches long. Was very unsettling, but I thought to myself, "who am I? I don't know if maybe these are different from every other clam I've eaten, so what the heck" tasted OK, were very chewy, I still wasn't convinced these were actual clams, but kept eating.  About 5 hours later I woke up with stomach cramps, proceeded to vomit all of the food I had eaten, and dry heaved for another hour or so while I began to become feverish. I lost a day of work and needless to say they have lost a customer.  The plus side of the story is that my buddy did not get sick, I checked with him but apparently he did some heavy drinking afterwards so not sure if that affected his toxicity levels.

Ada-4wstBpY6utEsOVEYgw.text: Just gross. Went there for breakfast because it was near me. The food was very poor quality and the restaurant area smelled like cigarettes smoke. My boyfriend didn't like it either. Go to The Cracked Egg, The Egg & I or Jamm's instead. TRUST me!!!

hIFogpOajF8R9JTvMILCzQ.text: $3.95 breakfast can't be beat.   Got the chicken fried steak and though it' not Texas large, it's a decent size and good gravy. Better than some chicken fried steaks I've paid a lot more for. Eggs were cooked right, potatoes crisp outside and soft inside...  ...basically comfort "normalicious" food (stealing that from Yelper Angela H's vocabulary).   Yes, it's not the best breakfast I had- but it's solid and a much better alternative to a shitty night at a Denny's. It starts at 12am so stop by for your after drinking breakfast noms. Beats a lot of the graveyard specials in taste and price.

3ErZumVaTihL7Zg072zf5A.text: We really liked coming here! My husband is a huge fan of seafood. He got the swordfish special and I got fish and chips. We also got mussels as an appetizer. The swordfish was amazing! I am jealous I didn't get it. The fish and chips were good. The mussels were very good and there were a ton of them! We will be returning. The service was a little slow when we were there, that's the reason for the four-star review.

pyPPUZYBmN_DXSp4OqJ9ZQ.text: We stopped by this northwest location of Shucks on our way into town. As always, great! I tried the four-item seafood combination which comes with no side dishes but lots of food. My choices were four oysters Rockefeller, crabcakes, calamari, and fried clams.   I knew I wouldn't finish it all and planned accordingly by eating the oysters first. They obviously wouldn't carry well. Delicious as always, and you can feel a little healthier by eating all the spinach.   My son had fettucine with a crab sauce. We put some of the sauce on the crabcake. Wow!!! Try it if you can. Amazing.   We carried leftover crabcake, fried calamari, and fried clams to the hotel refrigerator and ate every last bit. Delicious!  We've loved Shucks for years and always look forward to coming here.

H-YFCkZQu1YRNAhK8U1pYg.text: Best crab in town!  Always fresh.  Wings are great as well.  Everything we order is excellent.  Been here several times.  Waiter Jeremy is awesome!  Couldnt ask for better service.    Update:  we always went with friends and their kids.  Now they do not allow anyone under 21.  They just lost long time customers!  Its a shame but we can find good food elsewhere.

EwYlTcxd6Cj4qGPWG4jTdQ.text: Great neighborhood bar! Best seafood on the north side of town!! Gotta try the oysters Rockefeller and the lobster Mac & cheese, AWSOME!!!!!!

n8jBsKWPruzWwZMv5Ub07g.text: The food here is delicious. And service is normally good (but not always). I've had the "Sea Tacos" many times. The Philly Steak Mac and Cheese is really good (especially taking it home, three days later). The Mother Shucker burger is HUGE, but good, especially with their crisp tater tots.  The drinks can be strong (but tasty!). I love their different Iced Teas, such as Texas Tea and Hawaiian Iced Tea. If you can get their Fish Bowl, it's delicious! (and dangerous).  As far as smoking goes, it's apparently allowed  at the bar, which takes up over one third of the building. You have to walk past it to get to the restrooms. I've been here many times and the air is usually very good. Once in a while, it'll get smokey, even in the restaurant section. This section is not closed off from the bar area so, of course, smoke travels.  If they would eliminate the smoking, or have separate restaurant areas like the nearby Distill and Kopper Keg, I would upgrade to five stars.

Fkcw6n6lZGexpSyjZY0R4g.text: So I have been coming here for about 3 years now and this place never lets down! From the customer service to the food I love everything about this place.  First the food taste always fresh and the specials they have daily are amazing! They have a very wide variety of food "sea Food being a large amount" and I have tried many of their items! There chicken tenders and garlic fries are the BEST! Also the Lobster roll is one of my favorite things to get each time!!!  2nd Customer service has always been the best for me! The staff is very friendly no matter what time of day you go!  I highly recommend everybody try this place you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DAILY DEALS
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOBSTER ROLL AND GARLIC FRIES

3KTKXra7xJPm20oTZZkIQA.text: Went with my old high school friend today to get some appetizers. He had a beer and I had a coke. I was here before and wasn't real impressed. But that may have been due watching the golden nights lose the Stanley cup. So, I was ok with another chance when he suggested it. When I came in was greeted promptly.....I was surprised at the different food and selections to choose from. I'm not into seafood that much but they have good selection for us meat eaters. We went around 4pm and the place was relatively quiet which isnt a bad thing, the atmosphere was good. When the food came, it was good and hot. My friend and I enjoyed our conversation and the time here. Being a Vikings fan the only drawback was that it looked like a Bears bar. Lol. Seriously though, this was a better experience. I will be back.

yuC3nV2CeOr5RSGEqbvh0g.text: Ordered take out close to midnight for a late dinner after returning from a trip. Ordered a bowl of clam chowder and a crab Alfredo.   Clam chowder was thick, not a lot of clam meat and a little salty. Not bad though. Your choice of adding in saltines or oyster crackers.   The Crab Alfredo was delicious. Lots of flavor and chunks of crab on top! Not bad at all. Came with a garlic toast.   Next on my list to try is a lobster roll! Heard good things about that.

gCZuyOsHbWcKPJSo27dzaA.text: Come for the food. Stay because you'll be stuck here forever...  I'd love to say this might be a one time occurrence but it has happened both times I've been here. When we sat down we wait about 15 minutes before a server came to greet us and take our drink order. No big deal, they seemed pretty busy. By the time we ordered our food (about another 20ish minutes later) they place had pretty much cleared out. But even with an almost empty restaurant our server (Jeremy, I think?) hardly made an appearance. Towards the end of our meals we stopped him as he walked by and ordered a second round of beers. THIRTY minutes later we had to stop a young bus boy and ask if he could cancel those beers and get us a check. When our server finally made it over with the check he didn't even acknowledge the fact that we had to cancel drinks because it had been thirty minutes!   The food here is really good and fairly priced. But you'd be better off to order to go. There was only two of us and for a sandwich and one beer we were there 2.5 hours. As I stated before, this is not the only time this has been an issue here.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MxdW8xU4c5j5OSEf_VeF2g.text: If ever there was a time for a negative review tonight is it. The bartender (white middle aged male with grayish hair and beard) was a complete and total ass. We asked questions about time for our food and he would walk by us without a word or a glance. He was rude, disrespectful and just completely does not belong in any service based industry. I have never been treated like this and I will make sure everyone knows to never visit this establishment again.  I have gone there so many times, and I have never been treated so poorly in my life. I will no longer bring my money here...

vlV0adA7LYn4ecXSDdHxVw.text: The food has always been mediocre here. This was the first time I've had their breakfast. It will be the last. I ordered an omelet to eat on my way to work. What was served to me was the inedible atrocity pictured below. I only had one bite and went to work hungry. If you're thinking about breakfast here, just drive further south on Durango to Rachel's Kitchen where they use fresh ingredients. What Shuck's serves is not real food.   Update to the manager, Josh:  I actually called and explained my complaint in length with the manager on duty. He said he wouldn't be able to help me because I had no receipt. I told him that I would be sharing my experience in yelp and he was quite apathetic. Therefore, I am giving you this one star review. I would have reconsidered if someone had tried to help me; even despite the fact that most of your foot is canned or frozen.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AsyWFtlAEmbE4hIfOrzzTQ.text: 12$  For a Caesar salad with shrimp in it. It had 4 cold cocktail shrimp and wilted lettuce. Tasted gross /:

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12$ for a cheap salad..... only 4 cold cocktail shrimp a d some wilted lettuce.  Gross.

8LOrzshn-5pGzoR4Tuy9Lw.text: The tasty, reasonably priced food and great service is worth coming in. It's a great atmosphere that doesn't smell like cigarette smoke unless your sitting next to someone with a cigarette, which can't be helped sometimes because it's always busy.

fVOb1rhc3LQnbnO6xFWldg.text: Up date your menu stating no kids! My daughter is the only 7 year I know who cries when she is told she can't have it!  Updating my review from the response I received from management. Thank you very much for reaching out to me that was very nice. If you can look at your Yelp page, it shows you offer a kids menu. This was the reason we chose to dine at shuck's with my daughter. I have been there by myself and I thoroughly enjoy what you offer. And if I might add the young man who spoke to us did show great care in empathy when explaining children were not allowed.

m4bQaWX_U8omGPA8KE2QRQ.text: This is my go to spot - you can find me here at least once a week.  The food is great, been trying a new dish every time I go in.  So far they have not disappointed.    Sit at the bar with my Crown Apple and Cranberry drink, gamble and eat great food.  I must have drank the whole bottle because they were out last time I was there.  But I'm sure they will take care of that.

H14UMbut3Xin1UsSrP5ZlA.text: Don't walk in with a newborn baby. They won't let you in. You don't want to be there with an infant anyways because it REAKS OF CIGARETTES. Management should consider putting a large sign on the front entrance doors and posting a disclaimer on their website informing the public that no one under 21 period is allowed inside.

_0GfgcQGmiGRygV612WQOA.text: Imagine you're a pregnant woman and you want crab. But you're also reasonable and you don't want to pay fancy schmancy prices and you don't want to drive super far.       So, I'm that pregnant lady and I was on a crab rampage and my husband suggested Shuck's. I got a 1/2 lb of each of the snow and Dungeness crab, potatoes, corn on the cob, and cheese garlic bread. It was delicately cooked and smothered in garlic and old bay and butter and I ate EVERY LAST BITE. We will go back. More than once. The service was attentive and friendly, not over bearing. The atmosphere was enjoyable. Not too loud, we could actually talk to eachother while I wasn't actively stuffing food in my face. And overall we totally enjoyed ourselves.   Thanks for satisfying this crazy woman's craving for seafood. See you soon!!!  We went back... I did it again.

OWrCgaOxR_DH0X5lo7m2lg.text: First, let me stress that the food is fantastic! I love their seafood. However, the lunch service is horrible. We just after waiting 8 minutes for our server to take our order. This was after I asked the bartender to find our waiter (didn't see him anywhere near the kitchen). It wouldn't have been so bad if he didn't bring our drinks. Between those 10 minutes he never checked on the other patrons (there were only four).   The reason for this review is this not an isolated incident (happened three weeks ago with a different server). We gave Schucks a chance after not visiting for a year. But poor service from wait staff (not bussers, they are great).  He could or should have checked on us and the other patrons. But, he did apologize. A little too late and we will not  patronize restaurants with poor service no matter how great the food may be.

bgOnvD7ChSJJMewh0jdJuw.text: I called to place an order, and called 4 times before I finally got an answer. When I did, I couldn't believe the service that I received from the woman who answered the phone. To top it off, I was treated even worse by the bartender once I got inside. I use to love this place, but I will not spend my money where I don't feel welcomed. Needless to say, I left unhappy and hungry!  Thanks Josh/Steve, but unfortunately the general apology response is not good enough. It's apparent that most negative reviews are due to poor service, which means that nothing is truly being done about the lack of cares given by the staff. It's truly unbelievable!

wk1kpiQ9ePemFuqMbZM9Fw.text: My first visit here was a couple of years ago, I met a girlfriend for a late night snack. Sat at the bar and had some chicken wings which I enjoyed.   Second visit was at the Durango location after leaving work at Centennial Hills Hospital. I was craving for country fried steak so I called ahead and ordered to go for the whole family. It was late and their doors were locked and you have to be buzzed in. I sat at the bar and waited for them to prepare 6 country fried steaks which didn't take very long. He even helped me to my car. I would order from here again if I get out early and hungry for breakfast.   Third visit was at the Flamingo location. My boys and I came from Christmas Town and this was the closest I had bookmarked. Parked right in front and sat ourselves in a booth. It wasn't too busy, you guys know I like that :-) We all ordered a raspberry lemonade and ordered the crab spinach dip right away (too salty) while we decided our entrees.  I didn't enjoy the jambalaya I ordered, it wasn't spicy at all. The chicken alfredo, my 14yr old didn't finish so we took it home. Now the Schucks burger was very much liked. My 11yr old wanted to order another one! Hold on there tiger, that's enough for you today lol

54sFGOvu7kLqsklNRuxaAw.text: The food seems to be a little less fresh lately and the service can be sporadic.  But overall, a good place to go get your crab fix.
