utYxE9TcYiZD7FqsgjmIYg.text: Coming from the Northeast, you learn what is and isn't a good a New England Clam Chowder. Shucks is near the top of my favorite list in clam chowder. It's thick, creamy, and most importantly, it's meaty and there's a good amount of potatoes. I can say that their $5.95 bowl of chowder beats all of the $8 to $12 bowls that some fancy seafood places might charge.  I also had the Crab Alfredo. Creamy and a lot of crab meat. It was really filling. Looking at the menu, there are a lot of combos and other dishes too. I can not wait to come back and try more.  Just a note before you pack the family in the car to come here: you must be 21 to enter and the bar allows smoking, the dining area is completely non-smoking.

2LAX3atWKPFaRVDiBndw_w.text: If I could talk to John taffer from bar rescue I would tell him to go straight into this place. Let me tell you the service here ..... TERRIBLE. Sadly the owner is very cool and very nice took care of us once we couldn't stand this place but ..... He needs to fire EVERYONE.  If you get the oysters and your have EVER eaten oysters you will immediately know these are NOT fresh and not even good enough to be edible. Gagging by the first bite we all moved to the clams. They were very good but very sandy. So a few crunches will not surprise you. Then we went on and received our main courses. I ordered the coconut shrimp and they arrived cold with fries even colder. My partner ordered the pasta which he said the chicken seemed rubbery and the pasta sauce was yet again, gagging. The burger my friend ordered looked like a joke. Deserts were great. Beer was good. And wine was watered down. I hate giving bad reviews but if this place isn't helped it should be reported to food services. I was blown away.  If you know food you will be disappointed beyond belief.

__SUAHFC-mrHEMDm5i1eIQ.text: Okay place when you're in the mood for seafood and don't feel like driving to the strip. Although we've never hung out at the bar, it does look very enjoyable to have a nice conversation while sipping on a long island iced tea.  When we do visit, we enjoy the fish sandwich and anything crab they sell. And don't forget to get the criss-cut fries...

KkMOXFltJPaW9hvO-6FdJQ.text: i expected a lot better food considering the other reviews. I ordered the fried oysters and the fish and chips. Both were bad, bad, bad. The oysters were not pan fried, rather deep fried and cooked so hard they literally broke into pieces under the fork. The color was way too dark meaning they were overcooked. The fish was cooked so hard I needed to work the knife hard to cut it open and it split in pieces. The breading was not fluffy like one expects from a beer bar. It was a rock hard shell. I believe they just took frozen factory  made fish planks and threw them into the oil. The fish was billed as cod but it was so dry and stringy I couldn't tell what it was. True, one could say, "what would you expect from an oyster bar in the middle of a the Las Vegas desert?"  Well. I'd expect at least to find good tarter sauce. Nope, it was like cheap mayonnaise with pickle relish thrown in.   The mark of a good place is their pride in food and service. Insult was added to injury when I complained about the quality to my waiter, Gregory. I stated my dissatisfaction in an obtuse manner just to see what effect it would have. I told him that now I have something to write about. He said,"what?" I said, "how bad the food is here." Without a comment, he turned to take my credit card to the register. I paid for the meal at full price. I was never asked any questions nor introduced to the manager. I will never go there again and recommend against this place to anyone else.

4iwAk6NK-uSLM7ObIWKKew.text: Oh my gosh!!! This place is a definite No Go!! I have been 3 times. I give them at least that, and every time it was something different. The first time the food was cold. Not only mine, but the guy next to me had a case of for sure food poisoning if he would eaten his. The second time, I was treated like crap,(ignored, talked down too) I guess-it was because I wasn't a (Regular). And tonight, I was humiliated by the bartender. I was looking for a machine, after eating in the restaurant, I circled the bar 3-4 times. I passed a lady that was not gambling but sitting in front of 3 machines with her friends, she said "I'm leaving" I said, I don't want to run you off". She said I been here long enough, I lost a lot. So I sat down just putting my money in, and from across the bar the female bartender yelled "We have a waiting list for these machines. I had no idea! I could not believe how rude she was!! I get it, people were waiting. But I didn't know. If I was her boss, I would have fired her on the spot. You don't treat people like that. Three strikes! Their out. Awful place!

dRKuBopDeOrQcLew7M9KJw.text: Very disappointed in the food, oyster rockafellas tasted warmed up and everything was slightly cold when it was suppose to be hot . Also the shrimp cocktail had no flavor it was gross, I won't be returning.

1S0MmQ23qcdesJXWLizHcA.text: We love Shucks Tavern. The food is great, they are open late and it's never overly crowded. From salads and chicken fingers to big juicy burgers and lamb chops, Shucks never gets it wrong. Food and wait staff are fantastic. We highly recommend this place!

D1nFpaEylKjSjewGvFXBqQ.text: Love this place!!! As a Bears fan I love havering a place to go and watch he game with other local bears fans!! The food is always awesome and they have the freshest oysters!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nx6RvSjyo92MoiHNRt7sRA.text: If you want seafood at 3 AM this is your place! I tried the crab legs they were fresh and prepared well. The flavored butter was a very nice touch. You can get the crab with different flavors- old bay is what I tried you can't go wrong with that. The bar has video poker, it's an average style vegas bar. It's nice to have someplace to go for late night seafood if your looking for something different.

lOIZeL3rts-0DXRFfApyNg.text: Late night pick up for me and hubby, not super into seafood but he loves it, chicken finger and chicken wings Delish!!

u9MMGxuPzCGBoYCpVoTxjg.text: I was craving oysters on a Thursday night. Went to Shuck's because it was nearby my house and had dollar oysters special on Thursdays which is all they had going. Came in, sat down and I asked if they still had dollar oysters. Sadly, waitress informed us that it's $1.50 now. I looked at the menu and it's actually cheaper by 5 cents if you order a dozen from the menu. Had the oysters here before and it was hit or miss, some were way too small. Food price is overinflated. Food is just meh, for the price not worth it. Much rather go to seafood buffet or oyster bar at palace station at least you're getting your money's worth for way much more delicious seafood. Never again will I come here.

R-XYevu4YtlCQYWIFnW-pQ.text: My friend and I wanted to try a new place and didn't want to travel far from flamingo and 215 area. We enlisted Yelp to help us find a place to dine at. Shucks came to mind. After reading all the reviews this seemed to be THE place the be! so we decided to give it at shot.   When you walk in you see is the bar, we looked for a hostess but there's a sign to seat yourself. On the right hand side is the bar with some high top tables to sit at and on the left there are tables and booths restaurant style. We decided to sit at a booth with a large table because we were planning on eating a lot of food. We were greeted by the waiter and he gave us some time to look at the menu.   There is a pretty good selection of seafood and other items such as sandwiches and pasta to choose from. My friend and I went for the seafood. We ordered 1/2 a dozen raw oysters on the shell, 1/2 lb of black mussels, 1/2 lb of manila clams, 1 lb of snow crab legs, garlic french fries, and a crab and spinach dip. seasonings for the seafood we choose lemon and garlic.   The food didn't take too long to come out except for our garlic fries. First, came the crab and spinach dip. Consistency was different than what I'm used to. It was a little runny and had a strong sea food taste from the crab. I'm used to this dip being a little thicker and more creamy.  We had to add some hot sauce, salt and pepper to the appetizer so it wouldn't taste as bland. The chips that came with it were almost a cross between a tortilla and a pita bread.  Next came the oysters. Those were delicious. White meat not cloudy and didn't smell fishy. Then the rest of our food arrived.   Everything smelled so GOOD and mouth watering but when we started slurping and eating everything our noses deceived us. The food smelled so tasty and aromatic but it did not taste the same way. Weird right? I guess we are so used to eating at Hot 'n' Juicy. We finished our meal and I totally didn't even notice that our garlic fries never came out. We flagged down the waiter and asked them if they forgot it? He went to check and said the cooks forgot but it seemed like he forgot to ring it in.   The fries came out about 5 minutes later super oily and shiny with some sort of garlic white powder on top of them. I didn't even want to eat it. I tried one and the moment I bit into it I felt like an oil bubble bursted into my mouth.  This place is nice and clean but the service was a little poor. They only had 2 table sitting in that area with 2 servers serving as well.  The price is good for what you get especially since it is seafood.   So if you are looking for something close in the area with mediocore seafood. This will be the spot.

KVevZ4JKq5OhEqLO2Hjlaw.text: The food is gross. Probably a better sports bar--where you get wasted enough to eat their food. I gave it two stars because I went there hungry, so hungry I ate most of the lobster roll AKA imitation crab roll with a little sprinkle of lobster bits. It's an oyster bar that does not even have good oysters. I was hoping it would be a good small seafood restaurant, but no. But like I said, probably just a good sports bar.

j6FfOstIUaArHD0z20si7w.text: Great seafood Louie salad!  Happy hour 5 for $5 is solid.  Mussels portion was huge for$5. Service was attentive

VROoIXuMhYNsyjZyezPKSw.text: We love Shucks and the food, we used to like to go there and gamble while having dinner or lunch.  The reason i am giving only 3 stars is not because to the food.  We have attempted to go there 3 times in the last month, each time we go in the bar is full which is where we like to eat because we are big gamblers as well.  My problem is each time we have walked around the bar every machine is occupied and 5 out of 10 are with someone either talking to another person, playing on their cell phone, or eating and there is no money on the machine nor are they playing.  The bar tenders at most of the places we go to will not let us walk out and instead will ask someone not playing to please let us have the machine.  NOT SHUCKS they always watch is walk around then watch us walk out.  To bad you don't want the gamblers in i will not be attempting again their loss.

VADmLCZ1s1Aa_DVxLYyygA.text: Solid performer. We find ourselves visiting for happy hour on Friday to take advantage of half-price martinis and $5 appetizers. The clam strips are 4-star or better, and the peel-and-eat shrimp are plump, firm, sweet and meaty. Perfect bar food.   Wife loves the Lemon Drop martini and Mandarin Orange Cosmo. I made the mistake of ordering a 'real' vodka martini only to receive a glass full of well vodka, no detectable vermouth, and two olives. Had it been a decent vodka I would likely praise it, but it wasn't so I won't. .  The two problems I have with Shucks are the uninspired dining room (just an afterthought it appears) and the smokers in the bar.  Obviously a local hangout, and most are smokers. The ventilation cannot cope with the smoke; it's not like a haze hangs in the air but you can definitely smell cigarettes while anywhere at the bar.   You can move to the dining room to escape the smokers, but the dining room is the opposite of special or cozy and lacks ambiance of any variety.

EKPBBH23I_nTHhiaDjGGLw.text: I want to like this place, but the service is so hit and miss. I've been there twice, when it's not even that busy, and my drink glass if empty forever. I'd have to go out of my way to ask for a refill.   Likewise the food is pretty darn good for the price, but again the consistency is hit/miss. For instance I had a great sirloin on a prior visit, but on subsequent tries they never could cook it right. I ordered medium rare and it came out well done, as did the recook the second time. I just ate my vegetables and called it a night. (They did take it off my bill though.)   Also noticed that the last time was very smokey, while the previous visits were not bothersome at all. This probably has something to do with the ventilation system at the time.   They do have great hamburgers though, which are hard to screw up. So I might try them again.

CjI_GwsaXKAk7UwRU1AHLQ.text: Definitely my favorite sea food place! Their new menu is just amazing. The crew is nice, the food is good! We love coming here!

Q9xuIudnvHG7wzcIl259Ag.text: Excellent service!! Very good prices on the raw oysters. Plus there is no line to wait in!! Love the seafood selection along with their specials.

SlLiEozNd_r_HRNeD03JbA.text: Worst experience of my life!! Wouldn't waste my TIME on these people or place that's been closed at other locations .   Nuff said!?

QK3gs5A9UhO_EkVff5QosA.text: The atmosphere is perfect for football or any sports. Beer is ice cold and the food is really good.

9bIv-9hf8mVmfEoSmaeyLQ.text: Went here for Thanksgiving dinner. It was empty of course but who eats seafood on Thanksgiving anyway, besides for my family? They had a special turkey dish to accomodate those who wanted a traditional meal.  I ordered & shared the clam bake which consisted of dungenous & snow crab, manila clams, sausage, potatoes, & corn for about $25. It was definitely worth it but I've tasted better clam bakes before.  Our waiter was pretty slow. He forgot to put in our order for oysters. Apparently this restaurant is known for their oysters so I wanted to try some atleast but that didn't happen. He also didn't give us utensils. We pretty much had to wave him down if we wanted something. Pretty bad considering we were basically the only table there.

pYHc8x6_dOVcha_seyBTjw.text: Made a return trip this weekend and wished I hadn't.  My complaint isn't for the food but the service.  Waitress took our order and disappeared.  Although she made stops at the table next to us, it  was like we didn't exist.   We flagged her down once and then luckily were able to get the attention of another server in the restaurant for drinks, etc.   It made for a very unpleasant dining experience especially since it was my suggestion. And I should add that in no way was this place busy at all.

KlVy9S3DsJz01c_-ypTtPA.text: I have been pissed at this place for a while but decided to give it a chance tonight.  Kind of let bygones be bygones.  The reason I was pissed is that during the football season I called them to see if they were showing the Chargers game.  They said yes.  So we drove there and before we parked I went in and asked them again and they said yes.  So we went in (in our Chargers shirts) and sat at the end of the sports bar next to someone else in a Chargers jersey and told the female bartender what we wanted to watch and she said no problem.  We ordered beers and after a while noticed that the Chargers game should have already started.  So we mentioned it to the bartender and she went to check and came back and told us the owner would only let her put the Bears game on (there are a milllion tv screens in there and it shouldn't have been a problem to have our little end of the bar watching the Chargers).  So by the time we fpund another sports bar we missed more than the first quarter of the game.  Seems to me I did enough checking and they should have stood by their promises.  Anyway.... we tried the place again for the food.  It was only OK.  We had calamari appitizer which was OK but I would have liked cocktail sauce instead of marinara for dipping.  Ordered the Shucks salad which had crab, a few shrimp and a decent size peice of seared tuna on it.  The tuna was only so-so but the crab and shrimp was good.  My guy had a bowl of the seafood bisque.  He asked if they had any sourdough bread to go with it and they brought him two pieces of sourdough toast like you would have with breakfast.  Seems to me a seafood place should have some good crusty bread, don't you think?  Do not order the ice tea.  It is not brewed, we had to send it back.

1b7WvJYC_mFCmj51ICo9-g.text: I just got done eating here and I was very impressed with the value.  They run a two for one hamburger special everyday Which is awesome.   The burgers were good and not dry like at other places in town. There beer and bar food selections were great also.  Would recommend to anyone on a budget

wqrUD1zg_vFIhV3EUOoegg.text: Really enjoy coming down to Shucks to chill, have a drink, and eat seafood.  It's really casual and a great place to have a late night bite.  The seafood is fresh and the drinks are strong.  The wait staff is always really friendly and this has become a regular hang out for us.  They have daily specials and is a great place to watch football.

Sg6SYPUGsrdWgqO3gSNIfw.text: Great place for breakfast. Friendly staff and cheap prices with good portions.

uF1YrbxDs1qI0JJIhPRQpw.text: The service as well as the food is very good. A little overpriced. However, they have daily specials that are a pretty good deal. I'm not sure where they get there oysters from but they are very tiny. I just spent 2 weeks in New Orleans and ate at Acme's Oyster house four times. The oysters were 3 to 4 times larger at Acme. I think that if Shucks is going to serve such small oysters they should either give you extra (like Acme does when there's are small) or discount them. Just my humble opinion.

lbB8SVSKDBVsABCwgOu2gw.text: We went to Shucks for the first time yesterday for breakfast.The food was delicious! My husband had the crab and lobster omelette and it was sooooo good! The prices are great and the service was great! We will definitely be going back :)

AsyQv6Vi88PeYCWQHH4QfQ.text: I was huge fan of Shucks however, I was informed this morning that Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar on N Durango is openly discriminating against military combat veterans and wounded warriors by denying them service and throwing them out of the establishment.  The Shucks management at this establishment openly calls out and accuses veteran customers as representing "Stolen Valor" and immediately kicks them out of the place while the veterans are enjoying their meals or beverages that they paid for.  This behavior will not be tolerated by Veterans and Military action groups in Las Vegas NV nor anywhere else around the country.  Believe me veterans actions groups are going to be outraged at this company.  So in my opinion, if you are a military family member, active duty, National Guard, Reserves, a veteran or a wonder warrior consider boycotting all Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar establishments and I recommend you stay away from them!  Shucks Sucks!

OEZDWSUGTcLLmUKDEiZ9CQ.text: Absolutely great place!  Open 24 hours, so even when I'm working strange hours I can always stop in for a beer.  It's got video poker if that's your thing but I usually come with work friends to decompress.  Not only is it one of the very few 24/7 places out here in this neighborhood, it's FANTASTIC!  Usually have to choose one or the other.  Never knew it existed until a friend showed me, and I've been missing out!  Service is friendly and helpful, the barkeeps are familiar with even infrequent customers, and the food is bomb.  Try the seafood chowder!  It's incredibly delicious!

cu5I4A30d3PYNkSuGBUMmA.text: Just discovered this place today. Haven't had oysters since leaving Washington state. Food was great, oysters were fresh, oyster shooters were delicious. Only downside was the service. Waiter was pretty slow.

vtQL8whV_mWBzW1aM-vcmA.text: Awesome seafood in the middle of the desert!  Crab legs are on point, shrimp is amazing, lobster mac n cheese....yum.  I found this place late night after a night of partying.  The bar food is delicious too.  Service is solid but not wow worthy.  So that's a half star deduction.  And another half star deduction for being a Bears bar :). Go Broncos!

qGWjMeys0_c-tf7fGX5RDg.text: What a pleasant surprise to find this jewel in our backyard!  Had it not been for Yelp and all the reviews, we would still be looking for a good local fish house. The menu is terrific offering something for everyone!  Oysters, shrimp, halibut, cod, clams, crab, etc. All cooked as you like!  I had fish and chips, my husband had fried oysters, and we ordered an appetizer of fried clams. Oh, so good!  And, enough left over for lunch the next day!  Our server was so friendly and accommodating - she really made us feel welcome!  I can't wait to go back to our new "regular" fish house!

s939aASNLxHp1idKsrHiTg.text: The best place ever! The beer selection is awesome, the food is great, and the service is wonderful. It's close to my house and I go often. Nikki is my favorite!!!

tv-4phBxEqUUg4346rwoLg.text: So I came here with my parents while I'm visiting them in Vegas. The location is easy to find with plenty of parking, but I wasn't impressed with Shucks Tavern. When you walk in, it is DARK. There's a sign that says seat yourself, but it really isn't noticeable when you first walk in. We sat right off the bar area in what I guess is the dining room area. Being from LA, I can't get over people smoking inside bars. I guess Vegas' law says you can smoke in the bar but not in the dining room. Um... the dining room is the same room as the bar so I don't know how you'd escape the smoke. Whatever. I ordered a strawberry daiquiri off the menu only to be told that their blender is broken. For our meals, I ordered fried shrimp with fries w/ steak fries. My mom got a shrimp po'boy w/ regular fries, and my dad got a combo shrimp plate w/ steak fries. Mine came out as ordered but I had to ask twice for lemon. Mom's came with steak fries, which she doesn't like. She wanted regular fries. And dad's came out missing the coconut shrimp (which is part of the platter) because they were "all out." Long story short, something was wrong with at least one thing on each of our plates. Hello?! The service here was really iffy. The food runner looked like he was scared of the customers and our server was full on eating a meal while we were waiting for our check. We probably won't be back because the food was nothing special and the service didn't impress.

_jAv0ALeQBlQSTE0vEtViw.text: I normally go to Shucks for my Saturday breakfast. $3.95 any breakfast and $2.50 for soft drink... Ive made it my treat someone to breakfast place for the last 2 months... Last night my husband and I decided to go try their hamburgers and omgoodness, please know I am hard to please when it come to certain foods and burgers being one. This burger was just amazing, I was full after eating half the burger but it was sooooo good I almost ate all of it. Surprised they didn't have to call a tow truck to take my out to my car.... But seriously this is a wonderful place if your looking for a awesome burger or breakfast. Also Brit or Brad I think his name is, is a wonderful host... 2 shucks burgers with fries and 2 lemonades $24.00... And it was so worth it... They have Red Robin beat by a long shot

00Gs6Knjr-aRQp9M3AJt2A.text: Food was decent. Ordered shrimp combo platter which was great. What turned me off was the smoke from the bar. The bar wasn't separated from the eating area and we could smell all the smoke. Sorry, but that doesn't make any meal worth coming back.

sTIQ9jhxl0CGgJFmGhwzRw.text: Great chicken fingers and there 75 cents a piece  on Monday.  Loved them  The beer is great too

B8VMDzCkUiMgr3RWXGfZmw.text: This is my local bar and could forever be my favorite bar no matter where life takes me here on out. All the bartenders and servers are excellent and they do not short change you on any of the pours. Food is excellent if you like seafood and they have generous food deals every day of the week. Bears fan? Look no further for Bears games -- I do not want to spoil the enjoyment for you, just check it out.

S41LtCZJkiF1UEfDaNRcQQ.text: Sorry, but this is my opinion. I feel when you are working on tips, at least make a attempt to have customer service skills or a personality. When I have thousands of places to choose from in Las Vegas, please make me feel grateful I decided to spent my money here. What is sad is I left $5 tip and the server (Jonnae) doesn't even understand why. My daughter and I ate here on March 1st and ordered the garlic fries, which were amazing. Tonight we ordered the garlic fries and it was missing the parsley. We mentioned this to Jonnae and her answer was, "Oh it was just for decoration." Really, the pink flamingo in front yard is for decoration. How can you be inconsistent with the way you serve food in the same week?  Nothing like leaving a restaurant mad you spend your money there.

JOSYeyPsHtrNjHvvgaY9Vw.text: Great food great service. The shrimp nachos are phenomenal. The back and blue salad is also great.

Du9JQFT6DHxC6KDnt76PAw.text: This is Chicago Bears bar. I am not a Bears fan, but I play one on TV. They have great game day specials, and as long as you don't causer trouble by be ing over zealous for another team, they are quite nice, as I have found Chicagoans in general. So stop in, behave yourself and enjoy the great Bloody Marry's and Chicago Dogs, cheap on game day! Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

HbfxqJDW7WBsXDKcFW8NCg.text: Always great tunes playing...the 5 for $5 Friday is awesome! The bar always spins up a quality beve!

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back to the basics...vodka soda with lime
Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friday&#39;s are awesome with 5 for $5 8am to midnight! Mussels &amp; crawfish included add ceviche extra!

mXWS8nS8Lsc-3xF-tACq-w.text: Hands down some of the best seafood I've ever had! They had such a great variety and big portions! Great bang for your buck! Also They even brought my daughter out a piece of AMAZING chocolate cake for her birthday! It's a must try!!

KguCA_90zU7k7cetaG19JA.text: The first time I went here about a year ago the food was ok. Had the lobster finger appetizer and they were pretty good.  So, last night when I went I was so disappointed when I ordered the lobster fingers again and they weren't that great. Overlooked, over breaded, dry, and chewy.  Then I got the pan roast with clams. On the menu it says that there is also shrimp, crab, scallops, and white fish in the bowl. There was 1, ONE, scallop, 2 shrimp, 2 tiny pieces of white fish and NO, crab!!!!  For $18.95!!!!  What a ripoff!!   Also this place is a borderline dive bar. It reeks!!!  I mean literally the place smells disgusting!!  There is no barrier between the people smoking at the bar and the tables where you eat. And that smell hits you as soon as you walk in the door.  And this place is also so loud I was starting to get a headache!!  And I'm hard of hearing!!  Do not go if you want to speak to the person you are going with!!  It's that loud. Big screen TVs everywhere and I swear they had the volume turned up on every single one of them. They weren't all tuned to the same station but they were all tuned to some kind of sports!!!   Oyster Bar?  No!!  This is a sports bar that you can get some substandard food that resembles seafood.  I won't be back!!!

2tY8IlnC0M-sjrL-ckUuDw.text: First time trying Shucks and unfortunately will never be returning. Now I can not speak for the bar service as my experience was in the sit down family portion.   When we arrived it was seat yourself. We sat for about 5 minutes with many servers on the floor and no one came up to us. We were next to the hostesses table so we ended up grabbing our own menus after a couple more minutes of waiting. Finally someone came up after about 10 minutes to see if we had been helped. The first person we encountered asked if the "two" of us wanted to order our drinks. Never once asking about a drink for our 3 year old daughter (I guess she was invisible). Next we had a different server come take our order. No personality what so ever and very unpleasant. No smile, nothing. You could tell she was not in a good mood. Other than one other time it was the only time we saw her our whole meal. When done our meal we waited for the waitress to bring our check. There was not one person on the floor at this point (no clue where they all went). Finally after waiting some more we grabbed a bus boy and asked him to find our waitress so we could get the check. ** I will say the two bus boys we encountered during our meal were very nice! Too bad they were not waiters. They could teach that waitress a lesson in having a better personality.   My boyfriend and daughter enjoyed their food. I got steak nachos, but something about the steak tasted weird so I ended up picking it all off. At that point I wasn't about to complain and wait for a new meal. While most the food we had was good it was nothing special to make me want to come back after the service I experienced.   Now granted I know people have bad days, but unfortunately when your tip relies on giving your guests a good experience you need to learn to put that behind you. We did leave her a small tip as she did at least take our order, but that is all the tip covered.  ** Just to be clear, per in the response below, as I don't think it was, we did not tip our waitress poorly due to slow service (that was just part of the review). It was her poor attitude and the experience she provided us that earned her her tip. Food and and food wait times are the restaurants doing, and we understand that. The experience and personality are all on the waiter/waitress.

R-a8wFHp7yPgiNbdvEwUvw.text: This is the 3rd time I have experience eating here and got deathly ill. I kept giving this joint another chance and the food is so bad that food poisoning is always the result. Please check your expirations guys. This is not right!  Don't eat here unless of course you want to end up poisoned

vnIjh48TmC83JReHLzHDZA.text: Arrived around 6:10pm on a Saturday night, the hostess sat us down right away and promptly got our drinks. That was the best part of the experience.  Then, we waited for our server to order our dinner. And waited, and waited, and waited.   15 minutes later, our server arrived so we could order. Crab cake appetizer to share, lobster Po Boy for the wife, and I ordered one of their signature burgers. Garlic fries with both of the sandwiches.  15 minutes later, the appetizer arrived. Crab cakes were mediocre, at best. The presentation was nice, the Cole slaw was decent, but the crab cakes were over cooked.  15 minutes later, our dinners arrived. The wife liked the bread of her Po Boy, but the sandwich was missing the tomatoes that should have been on it. She also liked the garlic fries. It was a good size serving, about half her plate, with a good ratio of garlic to fries.  My burger was supposed to have their "Shucks" sauce, but it was so dry, I couldn't tell if it had it or not. I got about half of the fries that my wife received, but, my fries had much more garlic. When I finished eating the fries that I could, there was a three inch mound of garlic left on the plate. Simply not edible, and I like garlic!  15 minutes later, we received our bill. Of course it was wrong, the server had added an order of oysters from the table next to us, to our bill. 5 minutes later, we were able her about the error and she said that she was going to correct it. Then, they tried to deliver the order of oysters to us.   Laughable at best.   This is one of those combination gaming pubs/restaurants . Not crazy smokey, but noticeable when you walk in.   The tell tale sign was there when we walked in; there were open seats at the bar, a little after 6 on a college football Saturday night.  It didn't seem to be too busy, but it took well over an hour to get some crab cakes, a sandwich and a burger. Might have been an off night, but I'm not willing to chance it again. This place deserves zero stars.

JtMrfj_W5gtvVM0dUAnMbQ.text: I love this place. This place is one of the rear why I moved back to Vegas from Philadelphia. You can get any kind of food at any time of the day. I live their fried shrimp and fried scallops.

MSNaSZlCdXBX8rfEdNr-Iw.text: My husband and I have been coming here for years. The food is consistently great! Everything we have tried is just as good as the next. A big high-five to the staff all the way from the manager down are awesome. Check out the daily deals.

LVfL1PiVVcVcN7yKSo9UzQ.text: Brought my son here to watch the NBA Finals and for the wings and tenders! We had wonderful service from Jonnae! Great food and cold beer! See you soon!

2QDJ088kxsmC8irbLEURFw.text: We decided for shucks after searching happy hour places in our neighborhood and their happy hour menu sounded great.  So glad we have a 24 hour eatery just around the corner.  Don't know why we haven't become regulars.    Little did we know that the happy hour only got better after midnight! Darn it!  So definitely ask for their midnight menu. You can order a burger and fries for under $4 and oysters are $1, as well as under $4 breakfast.  On this trip we ordered the clam strips ($5) the waffle fries ($1.95), peel and each shrimp($5) and the portions were good sized and very tasty.   I will say the missing star is for the initial lack of service we received upon entering.  There is no signage of "wait to be seated" or "seat yourself" so we waited a bit and the bartenders just glanced at us a couple of times but still no direction.   Our server was not the greatest but I guess its past everyone's bed time. He never offered to refill our drinks but the gentleman who took over was very pleasant so we had a great ending to our late night snack!

ImLjRe46rtE8F1_CUNBB1A.text: As soon as you walk in, you'll smell the cigarette smoke. We sat down and waited for our waiter, which took some time. The food was mediocre. I'll never go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the feeling you are under the sea?

zipCL2GzK85QTV7GqwXnZg.text: Absolutely amazing!  Service was great!  Restaurant has a comfy relaxed vibe.  The food is phenomenal!  I got the oysters, clams and a black and bleu salad...everything was delicious!  First time, but not my last!

photos.caption: Photo of Shucks Tavern & Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MhOS3SQ-kiqUUUu43FgcOQ.text: Absolutely disgusting. I went years ago and haven't been back since. It's gross food for the price you pay, it was dirty, and service was absolutely awful. I'm surprised the place hasn't closed down because it's been such a long time, and the experience sucks. Don't go here unless you went here when it was new and grew up on it, then I can't blame you. But definitely not a good spot in my books.

LrqPQtXnt15348RRvUQKfQ.text: 5 stars for the surprisingly good seafood, super CHEAP prices for graveyard/HH, and the very friendly staff!  Drinks were heavy handed and kept coming!  Toss a couple bucks in the machine to keep yourself busy as well as the drinks :P  BTW, I asked whether they were KID FRIENDLY...they said YES!  Just not after 11pm...  One of the best places to eat late...look at these prices!  Oysters on the Half Shell ($1 ea after midnight!). These were pretty good, but even better at a cheap $1 bill each! Can't even buy em on the east coast for that cheap!   Oysters Rockefeller ($1 ea after midnight!): Garlic, Spinach and Monterey Jack Cheese. Again, can't beat the price on these! Overall pretty good.  Peel and Eat Shrimp ($4.99 after midnight!): 1/2 lb boiled in a seasoned stock. These were served hot, and had lots of flavor and Cajun seasoning. This HAD to be way more than 1/2 lb though...there were tons of shrimp!   Tasty :D  Fish Tacos ($9.95 not sure of HH price): Grilled or Battered Cod, Roasted Red Pepper Dressing, Pico de Gallo and Seared Cabbage. Not bad!   Waffle Fries ($2.50?). Lightly seasoned...good!  We used these as a starter until midnight hit!  The food is probably only a 4, but at those prices, everything tastes better LOL  Pics!  :

jq0f2tlOcMxZUxrft5DYbw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. They have amazing service and amazing food. I'm from Florida, but I will have to say their crab is way better. They have a couple different options on how u want it seasoned. Cooked to perfection. I've never had a bad meal from here. I recommend this place to everyone. -5 stars-

nDEH7lbRc9MyJOfSBuJlww.text: This place is so over priced! The thing that is disappointing is the food isn't that great for the price you pay. A funny note, it's supposed to be an oyster bar but they charge way more than if you go down the road to get oysters...hmmm. doesn't make sense. Menu is limited for a price point and for the amount you get and for the quality.

awBXpKpiYNOQlw6wplt5ig.text: The oysters were sandy ! This is supposed to be an oyster bar why couldn't they have better oysters come on ! I ask for a to go drink and they poured the drinks in a cup with no cap and straw lol my friend ask the bartender what type of drinks do they have and he said almost every drink umm okay like we were supposed to know. Other than that he was nice just the place needs some work.

ei_PNnIIK38DtK_fCbW66A.text: Went here 3 times now, and it has NEVER been good! This will definitely be the last time I try... The freaking crab was hollow, wings were soggy and sandwiches were awful. They brought out three different clusters and none of them had more than one or two legs with meat in them...they said it was because of a bad order??? Whatever. On top of that, only one that was even hot...and it was the very LAST one, and by then I was over it!  Gaming is also terrible. We both played hundreds at the bar EACH time and never saw anyone else hit anything either, which is so crazy. To sum it up? Mediocre food that they WILL comp when you lose at least 600.00, lol. No thanks!!!

w8OkBB2TTBtRizErjJKPZQ.text: Hurry up and open Distill!!! I used to love the place. (see previous reviews) but they are starting to get weird with the regs. we used to play and play, be served drinks and served some more drinks, suddenly today we get Sh***y attitude from our ex fave bar tender and told we have to now pay for cognac. Meanwhile others at the bar yapping all afternoon served with no problem.  we play at least 100 + and are told we now have to pay $10.00 per shot? when did that crap start? oh it's been always. nope! we used to be comped food and drinks and now they are becoming Timbers. ok. well if I put $20 in the machine multiple times give me two shots a pop. they are starting to suck service wise and I'll lose my money elsewhere because the machines suck as well!

HtUCRFMLF2cXurSUB4oSCQ.text: This place is awesome! The wait staff is very attentive and friendly! The food is tasty and the prices are very reasonable! I have absolutely zero complaints!

cwk_pUvOfUL0XIA_wh0hZQ.text: Delicious seafood. They offer a variety of things from seafood to burgers. Great place for a family dinner and reasonably priced. Service was great. I will be returning when visiting Las Vegas.

OLCPrEDOjsrGmvACukY1Pg.text: I've been to the Shucks on Flamingo on several occasions for breakfast.  On a recent visit visit I tried the baby Mother-Shucker burger.  It was delicious.  But enough about the other location  Stopped in at this location with the GF to grab a bite.  I found it to be pretty mellow given it was a football Sunday.  Some of the propaganda on the wall indicated this is a Bears bar.  I figure since the Bears played later in the day, this place was probably rocking.  This location is clean, spacious and everyone working was friendly enough.  Looking at the menu, I was reminded of the MOTHER-SHUCKER.  It was so delicious the last time I had it.  I asked myself several times, do I go big or do I go small?  I figured I was hungry enough to give the big one a shot.  According to the Sucks menu the Mother-Shucker is described as, "a full one-pound patty stuffed with bacon bits and american cheese. topped with lettuce,tomato, pickle planks, grilled mushrooms, melted swiss cheese, fried onion straws and our secret "mother shucken" sauce. served on a giant toasted bun. cooked to order."  I was given a choice of fries, waffle fries, onion rings or garlic fries.  I picked the garlic fries.  When the meal arrived.  The burger looked outstanding.  I had ordered medium well, but it looked like it was cooked just plain old medium. I am not hating, I can do either.  So satisfying was the burger, I did not have to at all the rest of the day.  I may or may not have been on the verge of meat sweats.  The garlic fries were all garlic and a nice compliment to meal. As was the Honey Brown beer.  The beer came out super cold and remained cool as I devoured the burger.  Not sure if I will ever put my body through Mother-Shucker experience again, but I will absolutely pay Shucks another visit.

ENAlnsQi-GLZDSIuSfZ9MA.text: I've been to this and the other location a few times. I've got to say that I'm surprised that I'm able to get good seafood from a bar. I love oysters so $1 oyster night on Thursdays is great to take advantage of. The service is decent enough. I mean it is a bar so I don't expect super tentative service or anything but the servers are always nice. The prices aren't too bad either.   I had the lobster roll. Now it's not big chunks of lobster meat like I'm used to. It's a lobster salad (which it does state in the menu) with mayo and celery. However there is a good amount of meat in the roll and it is tasty. When given the option of fries I chose garlic. Those were very good as well. They use a fresh make garlic butter with minced garlic over the fries. As far as drinks go, my mother had a mandarin cosmo which was delicious. I've had good experiences with this place so far and will continue to come back.

qP2teCg3tT_k_U9vP-wwVA.text: If you're in The Centennial Hills areaand you are looking for a great seafood restaurant with incredible burgers, soups, nachos or you want to stop in for an endless lunch for $8.95 this place is a must!  The restaurant itself is very large and very comfortable booths, tables and the bar stools are super cushy

mmQukmx3k5q-x2Huqxs2Lg.text: I have been 3 times over the last year or two. The first time my family met some friends for dinner. We ordered and one persons meal was completely wrong, and my husband giant burger was RAW on the inside. I mean not cooked at all!! Second time service was awful but the soup was good. Tonight and the last time I will attempt this place. My son ordered some chicken wings with onion rings and I stuck with the soup. We got fries instead, I told the runner we had ordered onion rings and he said he would bring them out. Our server, name never told to us, came out and said we didn't order onion rings. I told him I did while my son sat shaking his head yes. He then told me well I didn't hear you but he is going to bring some out. Ok, not that big of a deal, a little rude but whatever. As my son proceeds to eat his wings he realizes there is dark grimy something in his chicken. Idk what it is and it's in the last 5-6 of his wings. When the waiter comes back he asks if we want a box, absolutely not! One of the wings had what my son said looked like bloody eggs in it. The server looks at the food and says so it wasn't good? Really no! He leaves with the plate, so then I have to hunt down a runner to get my bill. I also ask for a manager. After waiting for a long time with no manager in sight I paid my bill and left. We will never return. Service was horrible, food was horrible. 3 strikes you're out!

TQLUQxSsPA2mNA71a9rOdA.text: Bad service, and so so food.  Overpriced for what you are getting and I pay to have good service too which never happened

tFRL7583jl1z3gGaAhWIdA.text: Hmmm..I don't know why this place is so underrated.Went around 1am last night for the 1.00 oysters (Which are no longer $1.00 they are now $1.50)Anyways I was a little skeptical about the place due to the reviews but I'm so glad I went anyways.Oysters were on point super fresh didn't experience any sand or what not.They had half off draft beer which was even more awesome!!Didn't get the bartender name but he was awesome as well.Beer was super cold, oysters were fresh bartender never left us thirsty (And he's a raider fan)The bar/restaurant was very clean.Definitely coming back

N8XKxuKC2_bTL-SLZ92E-Q.text: We called in for pick up and ordered the "Build your own (you choose 4)" which we choose (1) 2 order (1 lb) of peel & shrimp (2) Rockefeller oyster (3) calamari. We thought they will make this right this time. We got there and we checked if they get it together but again, people that work there are naturally idiots! We got 8 pieces of cocktail shrimp . They messed up on our order the first time and second time we are willing to come back and hoping they will make it right but instead they just ruin our night. It is inappropriate and no respect whatsoever. Don't ever try this place because people that work in this place does not care... I hope karma get to this people.

iR8v4woa-ZObDtXk2oyqhw.text: I'm just not impressed with this place. The non smoking section smells like smoke and the oysters are sub par. I don't think we'll come again.  We've tried this place twice because it is so close. I'm not impressed with the cleanliness or the service for that matter.  I do not recommend this place.

3enTDDAteoMUGYbqcoHiaw.text: My husband and I have been here many times. The service can be hit or miss, but the food has always been good. My husband is especially fond of the lobster rolls. I have also been here a few times with friends to grab some drinks. Prices are pretty average for the city.

nZuhk91MW8aX6DBUv35Dyg.text: I give this review with a full stomach of perfectly cooked steak and excellently prepared mussels! The service was exquisite with their wording, friendliness, and helpfulness. My mother has trouble deciding what she wants and the waiter was very helpful in helping her decide. The shrimp was perfectly fried and the mahi mahi was very light and fresh with scrumptious seasoning!

pR3edobxbNUtzTTutM56DA.text: Shucks is the best restuarant in Centennial Hills. Its not fine dining but good old fashion food. Daily food specials. I like the Friday $5 crawfish & calamari. Warning it is cheaper to buy a pitcher of beer than 1 glass . P.S. i am a regular here!

PWaOcboIF7t8SWuMXQjO6A.text: Best fried clams I've had outside New England. Lightly breaded, full sized, and great clam flavor. Nice tasting homemade tartar sauce. The lobster roll was okay, but too over-processed. Lobster meat shredded (a huge no-go if you've had a REAL New England lobster roll) and way too much celery. Green onions and seasoning in the mix take away from the lobster flavor. They should keep it simple and let the lobster be lobster. It's hard to beat a real Maine lobster roll though.

JaZICpT5ZJTkgcoB7nmQSQ.text: Took my boyfriend here after having not been here in years. Still how I remember it, and always wonderful. Has a strong cigarette smell though so if that bothers you maybe go elsewhere... but what do you expect. I recommend breakfast especially!

NQSONzXucybHZSbGGlRgZQ.text: I came in on a Friday around 5:00 P.M. We sat down in the bar area immediately. It was probably 10 minutes before we put in our drink orders and then another 10 before we got our first round and the wait times only got worse from there. At one point there ran out of glasses.

5scFI3IOY4vPc5HMvynQ_w.text: The hubby and I come here about once a week and we always leave happy and satisfied. The drinks are stiff and the food is good.  Really, what more can you ask for from a bar?  I usually order the crab Louie salad. The first time I ordered it, it was way too overdressed now I ask for the salad dressing on the side.  Problem solved. The seafood in the salad has always been really fresh and plentiful too! The last time we were there the hubby ordered the fish fry.  The fish was a very large portion and the batter was oh so yummy.  I have been recently ordering the snow crab and have never been disappointed in the freshness an quality of the crab.

CX-eP5DUYkfM_X7vntA0Pg.text: Great food. Horrible service.  The hostess is unfriendly and tonight we had the worst waiter.  I will be back but only for the food.

3C6e7p7xYrQq2zISaKDL7A.text: Dude WTF Guys.  You let me down. This place officially sucks.  Your oysters made me vomit, and the crab made my ass piss.  In the past I've had many a great experience, but the last couple times this has simply not been the case.  I didn't want to believe it at first when I found myself spewing chunks of rotten oyster flesh in to the toilet.  I thought eh I just got a bad batch.  So I gave them a second chance,"F*ck me right" I live less than two miles away and I found myself clenching my butt cheeks for dear life half way home. As I sat their, my ass securely suctioned to the toilet seat i vowed to never have another ass pissing experience at Shucks.  F you Dude. F you.

S_TpwdrMVm6P7kDlKkTonw.text: I'll start by saying I'm not a HUGE seafood fan, but the wife is, so we went to Shuck's (conveniently located about a minute or so from our house).   At first it looks like most of the 24 hour gaming/dining establishments in the area, but I wasn't really expected a fancy sit-down place, so I don't mark it down for appearance.   It should also be noted that this is a Chicago Bears bar for the Sunday NFL games, so any of our Chicago implants here in Vegas might find some joy in hanging out with other Chicagoans.  I got the Chicken Club and some waffle fries which was very good and very filling and pretty cheap (about $8.95). My wife got the 2 and a half pound bucket of Snow Crab Legs which seems expensive ($32) but the meat was pletinful and very good and like I said, I don't eat too much seafood.   They bring out all the proper equipment for breaking your legs and wet-naps for cleaning up afterward. So points there for being thorough.   The waitress was not super attentive, and it seemed like they had just one woman working the entire restaurant and bar area. I know it was a Tuesday night, but there were a lot of people in there, you'd think they'd have a second server.   All in all, Shuck's is who I thought they were (that's a Bears/Dennis Green reference for you football fans).   It's a good place to go if you're looking for a better than average meal at a reasonable price (with the exception of the crab bucket). We'll go again, just probably not every night.

g0zMalUdHgY0bHA7Nc3gEQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at Shucks. I'm from New England, and it's certainly difficult to find decent seafood joints in Las Vegas. This place has a good feeling, local dive, but clean. The service has always been friendly. I usually go for cold oysters and beer/wine, but definitely enjoy other selections. The stuffed shrimp appetizer is very good, I often find myself scraping the dish for the last of the mushrooms and rice/butter. Crab legs are fun, and this is the first place I've ever eaten dungeness crab, pretty good! I only wish they had Alaskan King crab! The mix and match of cold/hot plates is always a great idea if you can't decide and feel like sharing, too. This is my go-to seafood bar :-)

ZStOzrH5FepU8cdOTUj4pg.text: WOW! My new favorite place in the neighborhood. A little noisy during football games Sunday and Monday night but if you are a non-drinker this can also be very entertaining people watching. Now for the food, I have eaten there several times and there are no complaints the crab legs are fresh and cooked to perfection as is the fish, the cod is crispy and flakey the mahi mahi is as good as I have ever eaten on any fresh fish market. The service is friendly and they work their %%# off so we make sure they are rewarded well for the excellent service. I can't say enough about this local gem.

nDBRo2UUMWe8vjVLQxAW5A.text: This was our 2nd time here and it was even more amazing than the first. We got crab and spinach dip and calamari to start for only $5 each! Both were amazing. We added on a bowl of soup which was a little salty but good. Then for meals we had the shrimp platter and crab stuffed tilapia. Both were amazing. The time it took to get our food was amazingly fast. We had numerous waiters and waitresses always checking in on us. This place is a must go!!! Only down side is its a little noisy.

Uutxc1jaDKeIUFskPdFaTQ.text: Good place to get shucked up! The Shucks burger is great, crabs legs are just OK but the rest of the menu is legit. The atmosphere is pretty much standard for a bar, the lighting is just right for a relaxed atmosphere. Bartenders are always quick with an order and there is little to no waiting. This place is great!

3r17GOxhGgTyuPB2pqWCHg.text: If you don't go here,you are missing a real treat. They have many many customers, therefore fresh seafood. Oysters are small but seem to be fresh and delicious. Shrimp ceviche to die for. Crab fantastic, clams delicious, fish and chips great. They won't honor gift cards from anyone, and must process you credit card twice for anything over $100.00 dollars. Manager is very belligerent. No help at all. Wrote Corporate they don't care either.

QQ-Ljnv7O51AgtLrzYX1bA.text: Neighborhood bar with AMAZING food.  Don't go to the "other" fake freash seafood places.  This one is the real deal. Never had a bad meal here. The drinks are always perfect. Try the appletini. We even go here for breakfast since Vegas has a hard time figuring out a place for breakfast that stays consistant.   You won't be sorry. We love this bar.

dpofYSBUSDskggfqCzR8bQ.text: If I could give no stars I would!! This was the worst experience EVER!! Being in the service industry I usually put up with a lot and give the bartender a break but he was seriously the worst bartender in the world!! As soon as we walked in we were completely ignored and treated like nothing. There were only 9 people in the bar including us, so not busy what so ever. We looked over the menu for a few minutes ordered a salad and sandwich and seriously waited over 40 minutes for our food!!!!! The couple that came in after us ate and left by time we received our food! Instead of telling us our food was taking awhile or checking in on us the bartender completely ignored us and wouldn't even refill our drink, he dodged us wouldn't make eye contact. When we received our food it was luke warm and tasteless but we decided to eat it cause we were starving. When I asked if the food usually takes 40 minutes he said yeah at night it always does if we're busy...THERE WERE 9 PEOPLE IN THE BAR!!!! YOU'RE NOT BUSY!! He rolled his eyes and acted like I was asking a stupid question. I asked for the check and he said he took care of it, but at this point I would of rather paid the check and stiffed him. Don't act like a douche bag and then expect the world cause you decided to take care of something because you should of at the beginning. You're graveyard bartender is a prick and shouldn't treat locals like shit in a local bar! Seriously I will tell everyone not to come here!!

PIsenAHF6hC0bHEOjAokTg.text: We had a great time watching Monday night football, food was great, I recommend the crab, it's awesome

CWeIDSMZr0BwYSA-Q-sXaA.text: I would have given this place 5 stars except for the graveyard bartender on SUNDAYs is by far the worst bartender I have ever encountered and I work in the industry.  Don't got there after midnight on Sundays unless you want to spend the rest of your night wondering if your food or drinks will ever come.. He does seem to be really good at avoiding you when you need him though.. It's too bad because we're regulars there and he's served us several times and we still haven't had a good experience with him..  Any other day this place is AWESOME the other bartenders are great! Food is great! Atmosphere is great as so are the prices!

jAjtw-Z17cYqpZH0JodMqg.text: Incredible seafood, FRESH!  Great Prices.  Crab Lovers this is the spot.

_sPDB1rApgrfBheFxjrfHA.text: The wife and I have lived in this area for 2 years and never gave this place a chance.  Now we really wish we have come here before now.  There is a nice bar and the dining area is separate enough to really enjoy either side of the house.  I would not hesitate to bring my kid here.  I had the shrimp po boy and the wife had steamed crab and fried shrimp.  All of our food was very good and the service was great.  Good key lime pie too.

shnL09BJhIE_hD7kWMS0Fw.text: Great, go on Sat/Sun wine is half price and you cannot beat their pasta dishes.   Great late night all the fish are fresh and you get the benefit of a great sport's bar at no charge.

RwzLHkvvFBaiNP-wX-M4Tw.text: The food is okay. My biggest complaint is the fact that the restaurant and bar area are attached. There is supposed to be no smoking since its considered a family establishment. But I went there at around 8:00 for dinner people at the bar were smoking and the staff said nothing. It totally ruined my experience and I wreaked of cigarettes when I left.  However, if you're a smoker you might really like the place.

EDs42xrrbYkAHoRrJ5Uqow.text: The night staff is super friendly. My co-workers and I enjoy going after work. The breakfast is pretty average and so are the prices. The chicken fingers are average as well. The day staff is a little grumpy but It is our night time in the morning. There are several bars to choose from and this one is not on the top of the list.

DH-X1sDqlnZQZ_e7pqXqAg.text: Great spot to just stop in and get some pretty good food at any time of the day. Beer is nice and cold and they have great specials.  If you sign up for their email listings they will send you the weekly specials with free play.  Great food, great service.

TYWfMEUCPSOL0RZ42SGp0w.text: I like this place it's close to my house and pretty low key, pretty good selection of beer and food.

jGfgraTykjcfANX-T4WuVg.text: I had the Shucks fish fry. It was great! My only complaint was that I could have eaten more of the fish. I wasn't too find of the coleslaw, but Im not a fan of that in general. The service is also great, and my baby loved the clam chowder.
